Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: llfsell
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic and the hotel was perfectly situated in Old Montreal. The art collection is not to be missed. It is the private collection of contemporary art by the hotel owner. Did I mention that the price is extremely reasonable? I cannot say enough about how accommodating the staff is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in an Art Loverâ€™s Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1212check
Reviews.Content: What a find! We arrived in old Montreal late at night, tired, lost, our GPS on the blink and phoned the hotel. Reception stayed on the line to talk us through the one way streets to the hotel. If you love art you must stay here. Two massive works of art valued in the millions stand sentry at the hotel entrance. In the foyer there was an Andy Warhol portrait of the hotel owner. We were encouraged to walk four floors of the hotel to view the ownerâ€™s amazing collection of original works of modern and pop art by such artists as Miro and Lichtenstein. Our room was large with 14 foot ceilings, featured three original works by Chagall and was comfortably furnished including a large desk with free internet and a sofa in front of a TV. The hotel is a short walk from Notre Dame basilica, the Palais de Congress, Square Victoria metro and the restaurants and shopping of old Montreal. This hotel provided the best service weâ€™ve had in years. The staff were all friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. A great experience. Good value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ebrundown
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the rave reviews it's been getting here. The rooms are surprisingly spacious, the modern art is a treat (I was in the Murakami room), and the staff are personable and helpful. Free wi-fi is included as well. The hotel is in a great location, just where the old city meets the new one, so it's easy (via Metro or foot) to get anywhere. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and OUTSTANDING service”
Reviews.Author: NEFBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I popped up to Montreal from Boston for a quick weekend getaway. I booked L'Hotel mainly based on the reviews I read on Trip Advisor and I have to say I'm so very glad I did. Initially we missed a key turn in the directions to the hotel so when we called for assistance, the front desk stayed on the line with us until we pulled up to the door. Upon our arrival we were greeted by the manager and a valet, they were waiting for us outside. They were ALL smiles and helpfulness, really. It was so refreshing after a long drive to be welcomed so warmly. We were immediately free of our car, our bags and all of our woes! The room was clean and warm and nicely appointed. The Hotel has a wonderful art collection and there is something to look at on every wall, very cool. Every member of the staff we interacted with were terrific. We felt the location was very good since Montreal is such a walkable city. We highly recommend L'Hotel and should we return to Montreal this will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: baby_depardieu
Reviews.Content: You are literally staying in a pop art gallery - all the rooms are themed and spacious. The staff are lovely - the downside is that this hotel doesn't do its own room service - its outsourced to local restaurants, which means lots of choice and delivered to your room still - just not very convenient - esp if you arrive late at night. Other than this, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “chic/warm/cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chappy69
Reviews.Content: this boutique hotel smells good like vanilla with a hint of cinamon or chocolate all over the lobby. The staff were very helpful. In fact, they have helped my group get tour packages for montreal and quebec city. They have also helped us find transportation for our next hotel destination. The front desk staff, Melanie was very helpful and even went to the extent of booking for us a hotel in boston. The location was also very good. Notre dame-basilica was just around the corner. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends should they want to visit montreal.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hotel is lovely”
Reviews.Author: Demisemiquaver
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! We had a room on the 3rd floor with two queen beds. It was huge! Like other posters I found the service at the front desk to be outstanding. Very happy to offer advice and information. The hotel is quiet, being more in the business district than along the St Paul or St Catherine's strips but it is a very easy walk to both. Beds super comfortable, bathroom very clean. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great eclectic hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterangel21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great location. Great staff. Loved the art and colors all over the place. It seemed to be a quiet hotel as well (or perhaps that was just the off season). Not sure if we got a deal or what, but you can't beat a 4 star hotel suite with fridge and couch and big bed for just over $100/night. Do be warned- taxes and parking fees added a lot more to our bill than we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hotel in March”
Reviews.Author: Harry A
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Avante garde art in the lobby that is tastefully displayed. A quaint bar serving up good wines and refreshments. Centrally located in Old Montreal and a easy walk to all the local dining and shopping. Quiet and peaceful retreat. Manager Nicholas knows of all the local haunts for dining near and far. I would return if ever back in this local..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Art, Great People!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela K
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at L'Hotel and was amazed. I slept under an authentic Marc Chagall, I could place my eyes up close to the painting with no guards or guardrail in between. This is the home of Georges Marciano, one of the founders of Guess Jeans. Valuable art is everywhere for your enjoyment (Andy Warhols Campbell Soup, the LOVE sculpture) and the people who work here are not your usual cold hotel types. They are all unique folks who love this particular hotel. Nicholas, one of the general assistants, is a very special person. He is full of good conversation and great service. This place is in the heart of old Montreal, charming, small scale and friendly. The only small negative, I think they could step up their continental breakfast a bit, not really worthy of the rest of the experience. I live about an hour and a half away and urge my fellow Vermonters to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Just Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rob549
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three days. While we enjoyed the well appointed room and the art galley lined hallways, it was the staff that made our stay the most enjoyable hotel experiences of our travels. They made our restaurant reservations, coordinated our transportation in Montreal, and gave us excellent advice on places to visit and restaurants for breakfast and lunch. We look forward to staying again at L Hotel!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Art art everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Rachel L
Reviews.Content: L Hotel is a wonderful centrally located hotel with great service and great art. Located in Vieux Montreal near many of the major sites and between two metro stop. We were there for a girls weekend in the middle of winter and had a blast. They upgraded us from a double to two adjoining rooms so we had our own bathrooms - score! The staff is super friendly and we spent two lovely evening at the lobby bar chatting with the manager and learning the whole story of the hotel. The art is everywhere - in the lobby, in the rooms, in the hallways - and it is just a pleasure to be around. Only downsides - No restaurant and the continental breakfast is average so I would recommend venturing out to the many, many nearby restaurants choices (Le Cartet for breakfast, Olive something for lunch). And noises from the hallway can be easily heard which was only problematic for afternoon naps and on 3 am rowdy party returning home. Surprisingly, noise from outside was not a problem. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “I love L'Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: niskytraveller
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great location in old Montreal. Had a convention at Place Bonaventure, but why stay in a Hilton when you can stay in Old Montreal? Walked to everything. Our room was wonderful, modern, close to everything. Loved their contemporary art collection. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! You don't want to miss it!”
Reviews.Author: CindyZX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. This is one of the best hotels I have ever experienced! Love the design of the lobby and the room. Staff members were nice and friendly. Service was monumental! I was in the lobby one day waiting for the day tour to pick me up. I waited for about 40 mins there (eventually it turned out that there was some miscommunication between the tour group company and the driver, so the driver never showed up and I cancelled the tour). The hotel staff members helped and called the tour company couple of times and kept asking me if I would like to have something to drink. Very impressive! Btw, if you stay at this hotel, don't miss out the sushi restaurant around. It is called Tatami. It is in the back of the hotel. Only one or two blocks away. Food was delicious and service was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: nmkUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Feb2012 for three nights and it was perfect. It was not only 'no complaints' but the staff and the hotel really were beyond our expectations. The staff was proactively helpful in all matters (we did not need to ask; they volunteered information, drinks, etc etc), and the rooms and the public areas were very nice. We were a couple staying in a normal size room and found it big enough. There is a good size bed (with very comfortable beddings), a writing desk and two chairs. The bathroom is big enough to fit two people in to get ready etc. It is not huge - but a usual size boutique hotel room. We got a good deal ($120/night) too.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located artful hotel with unmatched hospitality”
Reviews.Author: scubascubagirl
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I had an amazing week in Montreal just after Labor Day. What stands out the most about this hotel is the mind blowing hospitality. Every time we asked the front desk staff for anything, they could not do enough to help us - we asked where something was and 2-3 staff would be checking and double checking maps, sharing their opinions and more. Everything they recommended was a complete hit. They were all so dedicated to ensuring we found what we needed, and it was so very much appreciated! Of equal importance was the location - a short walk to the cobblestone streets in the Old Port & all of its shops, bars & restaurants, while also a short walk to the Metro, the wonderful Notre Dame Basilica & light show and some great restaurants on the same street or one street over. The rooms were really spacious and the modern, Warhol-esque pop art all around was super fun. The lobby was also a chill place to talk & hang out, and also where I discovered how much I loved a loved a local beer that the staff recommended. They also had a Brazilian band one night during happy hour, which was a nice touch. We also really enjoyed visiting the Botanic Gardens - especially the Japanese Gardens within; eating smoked meat & Poutine; shopping Rue St. Denis & Rue St. Laurent, and nightlife in Le Village. The most beautiful colorfully painted and landscaped townhouse I've ever seen I found en route from Rue St. Denis to Rue St. Laurent. In old Montreal, a drink at the rooftop bar above Hotel Nelligan is great for happy hour/sunset if it's nice out and quite a busy scene. L'Express had totally delicious French food & not too pricey. Had to make a reservation in advance. Le Nil Bleu is an Ethiopian restaurant that the concierge recommended & I went but they had closed for lunch so I missed it. I never went to St. Elizabeth's pub but my friend Bobby went & said it has an amazing vibe. And if you like orange soda or cream soda you must try a Crush cream soda mousse - a perfect combo of the two.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the LHotel”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle-Teeth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LHotel just before the holidays this year, and had an excellent experience. The Hotel is a great combination of classy, and fun and funky, with interesting artwork in the lobby/bar area and hallways. The hotel was very well-located in the sense that it was on the edge of Old Montreal, but still fairly close to a Metro station. Lots of beautiful old banks in the immediate neighbourhood, and the amazing Notre-Dame Basilica is also just down the street. The biggest contributor to the comfort of my stay was the extremely welcoming and helpful staff - Nicolas in particular (thank you!). I was travelling on my own for this trip, and they helped me truly feel at home at this hotel. I can't say enough good things about the team at the LHotel. :) I had a room on the 4th floor facing the street, and the room was very large, with high ceilings, and was also well sound-proofed. Also very well maintained. Comfy beds! I was lucky to have a little fridge in my room, which made a big difference in the comfort of my stay. I was told that although fridges are common in the suites at this hotel, they aren't generally included in regular rooms (which is what I had); just something to clarify/confirm with staff if a fridge is important to you during your stay. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, so can't comment on that. A coffee maker in the room would have been a nice bonus, but there is a Starbucks on the way to the metro so I found that quite convenient. I got a very good rate for my stay, and I can't believe the value for my money. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences of my life!”
Reviews.Author: mosesf16
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels all over the world in my 16 years in the military, and the LHotel Montreal was perhaps one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. The customer service was unbelievable! From the minute we arrived, we were treated to the very best of Montreal. Immediately had linens and baby bed brought to our room, hotel staff helped us with parking, room service super quick. Daniel even ran after us to ensure we didn't leave a baby blanket behind as we left. If we are ever in Montreal again, we will stay at the LHotel for sure. As I said, one of the best experiences in hotel stay I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “At home in Europe”
Reviews.Author: zeniatrips
Reviews.Content: Our testimony is first â€œon meritâ€� and then â€œcomparativeâ€� on scale 1 to 5. On its merits, our Superior room gets top score 5 for cleanliness, 5 for bedding comfort and linen, 5 for service, friendliness, instant assistance,5 for peace and quiet, 5 for location if youâ€™re on business, attending a conference or visiting Old Montreal. One must add modernization of the structure was followed by a real effort to furnish with first class antiques. A nice and cozy assemblage. This was the closest weâ€™ve come to a room of similar size and price in Cordoba, Spain, last year. We bring up â€œcomparativeâ€� because the competition within 300 feet is the Intercontinental, the Westin, and Hotels of the World. So if you are looking for 24-hour upscale restaurant; or to build up frequent traveler points; or a bar in the room; or a swimming pool; or in-house link to Montrealâ€™s unique underground shopping, then you have to consciously decide to go without it. Lâ€™Hotel was carved out of a 1930ies bank building and reminds one of European standards; the owners focused on arts, displays and beautiful furniture of yonder years. Most or all the paintings on the wall are for sale. Renovations are up to par : WiFi, iPod dock, 40inch super TV, itâ€™s all there: Pleasant, well done, spacious. But I wouldnâ€™t bring babies and young kids though it is not impossible.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Karine R
Reviews.Content: Discreet, refine, easy access to view one of the best private art collection in the world. I fell in love over here. Above par service...

Reviews.Title: “What a 50th birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne1776
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband for his 50th birthday and took him to Montreal for three days in December. We live in New York City so it was a short 1-1/2 hour flight. It was second trip to Montreal, his first. We stayed at L'Hotel in the old part of Montreal. I booked a King Suite room and were given the Roy Lichtenstein suite. It was fabulous! The 2-room suite was huge. The bed was large and comfortable. There was a fireplace and 5 windows in the room. The second room had a couch, table and fridge. The bathroom was terrific with a memorable steam shower. The staff, especially Nicholas, was amazing. They even sent us a bottle of champagne! I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone vacationing in Montreal and I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Thanksgiving Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mom-of-Max
Reviews.Content: My sons and I spent Thanksgiving weekend at LHotel, Montreal. The rooms were spacious and the beds and pillows luxurious. The staff was very helpful and always pleasant. All out inquiries were handles quickly and efficiently. Breakfast was very nice and ample choices were available on the buffet. The croissants were heaven. Hope to go back in spring or summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very characterful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: viaBloomsbury
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of good hotels to choose from in Montreal, but if the price is right then I would certainly recommend LHotel. First of all the location is very good for business or leisure. You're close to the water, have many great attractions within walking distance and are also well served by nearby public transport. I didn't drive, but noted a popular open air parking lot directly behind the hotel. There is a bike hire stand just up the street which I made use of (not operational in the winter months) and found to be a great way to see the city. There are some wonderful places to eat nearby. I highly recommend lunch or dinner at Ferreira Cafe, which was a real highlight of my trip. As you ascend the steps into the hotel, if you're like me you'll probably head to the obvious desk at the top. Wrong! This was the concierge desk and for the bar. Just to the right was the 'front desk'. Check-in with swift and friendly. It was explained that Wi-fi was complimentary, but breakfast is an option extra, I passed on breakfast during my stay as I like to check out local spots. My superior room was very nicely appointed. It wasn't huge, but perfectly fine for a lone traveller like myself. If I were a couple, I might pay the extra and get a suite. I walked past a few while they were being cleaned and they appear much more spacious. As other mention, big windows and high ceiling make the rooms very bright and airy. The bed was good and noise was minimal at all times. My only real complaints were the lack of free power outlets in my room. The only free one I could find was under the writing desk and a bit fiddly to get to. Accessing another one required unplugging a lamp. The television (which I don't really care about) also suffered from a fairly grainy picture quality, which seems to be an issue at many hotels for some reason. Some people may find the hotel a bit light on services and amenities, the room service is minimal and there are no fridges/minibars in the rooms for example. I spent a bit of time at the bar. During the week it was very quiet, but perhaps gets busier at the weekend. The prices aren't exactly cheap, but also not horrendous. The selection of wines and beers are very good, food choices are minimal. The service was warm and friendly, the bartender told me that the building was formally a bank, the beautiful wooden staircase you see in the bar is original and adds to the grandness of the room and all its wonderful artwork. So overall recommended if the price is competitive vs other luxury hotels. I would certainly stay again, but would check a few other good hotel rates before pulling the trigger.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dahela21
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms were very clean with high ceilings and comfortable beds. Art collection with original paintings is definitely worth mentioning! Overall great find!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jlm2053
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Our room was luxuriously large. I don't know that all the rooms are as big, but I do understand they all have super-high ceilings as ours did. The room was also immaculate - from the linens to the bathroom. I usually have a hard time walking barefoot in hotel rooms, but felt comfortable doing so here. (The only little things were a burn mark and small stain on the carpet, and the armchair in the room was a bit threadbare. Also water pressure could have been better). The general decor of the hotel is really upbeat and modern. We had an enormous Beatle's canvas hanging above the bed. And the walls were painted a cheery yellow. Also, we never once heard our neighbors. And for the first time in a long time, there were plenty of pillows on the bed - all soft. The location is great - such a close walk to Montreal's Old Port. Just don't expect everything to be open on weekends as it's pretty much a business district (meaning many things are shut Saturday and Sunday) - but regardless, we found plenty of things to do and eat in the area. There's also a nearby subway. And we were able to walk to Chinatown as well. It's also very close to one of our favorite sites, the Notre-Dame basilica. The hotel also offers a lounge area where you can order a drink if you want, or just hang out (which is good, because the drinks are expensive). We noticed that on the Friday of our arrival, there was a bossa nova band playing during happy hour. We missed the show, but thought it was a nice touch. Also, in general, we found the staff to be very kind. Breakfast and parking, however, are both a bit of a ripoff. Friends who were traveling with us had a miscommunication regarding whether breakfast was included in the cost of the room and were upset to learn - after having eaten, that it was not. So be sure to be clear about this before eating. (Also, there is only very limited room service). My complaint about parking is that there are many lots around the hotel that have far lower parking rates. If you're comfortable parking overnight in an open air lot, then don't bother using the hotel service which is $22 per night. But if you want the security of the hotel valet parking, at least they are very good about making sure your car is available when you need it. That's about it. I would definitely stay here again in the future. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelreview77
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Great room size, decor and comfy beds. Excellent front office staff. They also have a great art collection with original paintings from the masters. Try as hard as you can, there's absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. Don't forget to enjoy a drink at the lobby bar looking at the great paintings and listening to live music. There are no slippers in the room. There you go. That was what was missing!! :) Absolutely stay at LHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-sited for the sights”
Reviews.Author: four_neills
Reviews.Content: My wife booked us into this hotel for our 25th anniversary. It is a more plush hotel than we would normally choose, as we normally abide by our "going to see the sights not the hotel room" mantra. However, this was a special occasion! We flew in from Toronto, and caught the 747 Express Bus from Trudeau Airport to downtown, getting off at Jeanne-Mance We then walked about 10 minutes to L'Hotel on Rue St Jacques. If you have larger bags it would be a little tedious - we had cabin-sized luggage. We came to soak up the old port area so we did not even consider taking a car. However, the public transit system is excellent if you want to explore further afield. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the room was fabulous! It was beautifully furnished and clean and tidy throughout our weekend. There is no pool, which would have been nice after a long day on one's feet! We had the Edward Ruscha suite which was very spacious. L'Hotel promotes itself as an exhibit of contemporary art, hence the link to Ruscha. Unfortunately the weekend we stayed was the weekend they chose to remove 99% of the art work (for inventory reasons?) so many of the walls in the hallways and foyer were bare. We chose to walk everywhere and there is plenty to visit within minutes of L'Hotel. We did not eat at the hotel; instead we visited local cafes and restaurants - so many to choose from! We thoroughly enjoyed breakfast at MarchÃ© de la Villette on Rue St Paul West at Rue St Pierre, which we found Parisienne in atmosphere. Plenty of apparently regular patrons coming and going gave it an authentic feel. On our last day the staff happily stored our luggage while we went to enjoy the warm autumn day by the port.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel with an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Lpfetzer
Reviews.Content: Columbus Day Weekend was the perfect time to travel to Montreal. Having never been before, we were going to celebrate my daughter's sweet sixteenth birthday. We picked the hotel after reading reviews here and examining their website. I had very high expectations and couldn't have been happier. We arrived late on Friday night and were greeted by the most gracious bellmen and front desk staff. Entering our room we were thrilled to find a gorgeous suite that was easily big enough to fit our family of 4. I had heard that the hotel was previously a bank. The rooms had the highest ceilings and windows that I have ever seen in a hotel. The halls were lined with beautiful artwork, worth taking a stroll around just to enjoy the museum quality. The breakfast included with our room package was not large, but was delicious and plentiful for our tastes. Location was perfect for us, just a block or so from Notre Dame. The Old Port area can be enjoyed just by strolling through the streets. The shops and restaurants are great. Each time we returned to the hotel, worn out and tired from exploring, the staff was right there to greet us and offer a cold drink or bottle of water. They were very helpful with maps, directions, and helpful suggestions for walking tours. I would stay here anytime I return to Montreal, which I hope is soon

Reviews.Title: “One very nice property”
Reviews.Author: dkeith
Reviews.Content: Usually stay closer to Ste Catherine Street when in Montreal so this was new location and it worked very well. It is at west end of Old Montreal so a reasonable walk to shopping on Ste Catherine St or Place des Arts ( just under 15 minutes) and of course easy exploring of Old Montreal to the east. The hotel staff were great -welcoming and helpful at all times. Nice ambience - from cosy lobby to lovely rooms with dark wood and high ceilings. From my view , the lobby works just great with small front desk and very comfortable lounge- neither cramped nor oversized. Continental breakfast in small dining was very pleasant. Caution- breakfast options in neighborhood are limited ( Eggspecations is two minute walk but not much else beyond coffee shops ) so judge your self accordingly. Room rate made this very good value. Negatives - some finishes need a small bit of work ( emphasis on small) and coffee seemed to be hard to come by in the evening with little available in neighbour hood and no in room coffee maker. On the plus side there was hot coffee in the lobby in the mornings- nice if this was available in the evening. Bottom line - a very nice inn , do not hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Littlebear9
Reviews.Content: FiancÃ© took me here for surprise trip. He booked the hotel himself and I am usually pretty picky. The hotel is just north of Notre dame church and we could hear the church bells from our room, we stayed in the Robert Motherwell suite. We walked everywhere from our hotel which was awesome. The service was friendly and good. Hotel was minorly run down in certain respects, for example paint in the hallways had been touched up from noticeable peeling. Otherwise very clean and nice. Our linens were really high quality and nice towels and robes, bed was really comfortable. I would go back for sure, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanDG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the 2nd time at this wonderful hotel in October 2011. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly, pleasant, knowledgable and professional. Our room was huge and included a mini refrigerator. The breakfast is a good way to start the day and also to save a few dollars. The hotel is located in the financial district which is right next to the "old town" and port. If you enjoy walking, you can see most of the sites by walking or the underground (subway) is also a good way to get around the town. If we return to Montreal, we would definitely stay again at the LHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: westcoastcutie
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in Old Montreal. Not as luxurious as some in the neighborhood but at a much more reasonable price. Beautiful high ceilings, very clean, staff were very accommodating. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and comfort all rolled into one”
Reviews.Author: GPS11
Reviews.Content: The LHotel exceeded our expectations from the minute we arrived at the front and were greeted by the doorman and escorted us to the front desk. the staff upgraded our room to a beautiful suite. We were able to valet park our car at a convenient parking garage and walk to restaurants and sights in Old Montreal City. The staff was helpful and polite and the downstairs lounge was a great spot to unwind with a nightcap at the end of a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay in old montreal”
Reviews.Author: B s
Reviews.Content: I visited the LHotel in old Montreal and was treated to an experience beyond my expectations. It is a feast for the senses staying in an art hotel. Being surrounded by the works of Chagal, Margarette, and others is an experience that lifts one's spirits and makes you feel grand. Evenings in the lobby/lounge were magical due to Nickolas. He made the most fabulous suggestions for drinks, each one better than the next. His positive personality brought out the best in everyone. Nickolas made my experience at the LHotel unforgettable. Staying right in Old Montreal, just stepping put into the old city was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Razmataz65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and chose this hotel because of location. Its proximity to both Old Montreal and shopping on St. Catherine's is excellent. You can walk anywhere from LHotel. Staff are very friendly. The hotel is impecably clean and rooms are so spacious. Our only complaint would be the parking. There is no specific hotel parking, but valet parking is offered. Street parking (metered) is available but there is no parking between 7-8am daily Mon-Friday (rush hour). You have to come out in the morning to move your vehicle for the hour so you aren't ticketed. We opted to park 2 short blocks away in public parking at a rate of $15/day. Overall, wee would definitely recommend this hotel for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, good location, comfortable room & nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eatfishcambridge
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here as a family while my husband attended a conference. The staff were all wonderfully helpful and nice - every one made the effort to make us feel at home and I have never experienced that type of genuine hospitality in a hotel before. The beds were comfortable and the shower good. Wifi worked well. The room was a little dim though, so bring a double adapter for your electricals to avoid pulling out plugs serving the lamps. Breakfast was good and served in a big bright room. There was a booster seat but unfortunately no high chairs. The bar/lobby was a very pleasant place to sit and good for a drink in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: DPD_Chicago
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful. Location was terrific -- half a block from the St. James Hotel -- three blocks from.Notre Dame Free wireless. A little on the pricey side, though (I paid $260) -- but Montreal seems to be pretty pricey. The "business center" is in the same room with the "fitness center" -- which makes it a little impractical to actually work in. The free wireless / combined with a nice work space in the room makes it largely a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at LHotel this past weekend. From the moment Nicholas rushed to greet us as we parked the car to the gracious dining staff who made a last-minute breakfast so enjoyable, the staff of this hotel merits a 5-star listing. The hotel never felt crowded or noisy, although it I overheard the receptionist tell someone it was full. The lobby/lounge is small, but cozy and well-appointed--perfect for a drink and listening to some live Bossa Nova. Our room (Rauschenberg) was nice and very clean. It felt just a little worn, but nothing that made a huge difference. The bed was comfortable, the sheets crisp and clean and the cleaning staff did a great job for each day of our stay. I had read so much about artwork around the hotel that I was puzzled by the somewhat randomly placed pieces in our room and also that a significant number seemed to be missing in the hallways. Breakfast was lovely and delicious and we also liked that good coffee was available at the bar all morning. Overall, it was such a relaxing and enjoyable stay that there is no doubt we'd return. The staff were all so friendly, efficient and helpful that we couldn't have asked for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for those who want to splurge”
Reviews.Author: delegate88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for a night, and it was very nice. Room was clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. Continental breakfast was included. Staff was very professional and friendly. I would stay at this hotel again, but only for a special occasion as it is more on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul-in-TO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our family of four for 2 nights. Check in was efficient & smooth. Hotel is clean, modern with some great art work. We later found out it has Canada's largest private art collection with works by Picasso and Miro, among others. Rooms were large and well appointed, with free WiFi. Breakfast is great value, breakfast room is bright, and relatively roomy compared to many we've been to. Live music in the bar is a nice touch on Fri & Sat nights The hotel is in the old town, the metro and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.a

Reviews.Title: “Great location; cozy room; free wireless”
Reviews.Author: EmSaso
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in early October 2011 and we loved the location in Old Montreal. It is walking distance to two subways stations (under 10 minutes), Notre Dame Basilica and the best restaurants in the city. The staff were very helpful and they were friendly and cool without being overly formal. We had a basic room and it was nice. It had a desk, closet and comfortable bed -- no couch. My only complaint would be a lack of bathroom fan, which meant foggy showers and offered nothing in the way of privacy when you wished to -- ahem -- use the facilities. But I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: LOVENATLPARKS
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t think that there are enough wonderful things that I can say about L Hotel in Montreal. My wife and I stayed there the weekend of Sept 17-19. We had booked on the hotelâ€™s website after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the second floor. The suite consisted of a bedroom and a sitting room along with a very large bathroom. The television included several US stations as well as local stations, most of which telecast in French. The hotel has an internet connection on the first floor (beware of the non-qwerty keyboard) and a beautiful bar and lovely breakfast room on the same floor as the hotel reception. Breakfast was superb. The front desk staff was extremely helpful in organizing our two days of sightseeing in Montreal. They recommended a lovely walk through Vieux Montreal so that we would be acquainted with all of its highlights. We returned to this route several times during our stay. They also recommended the Rue Duluth/Rue St. Denis area which we reached by Metro and walking to/from Mont Royal on a spectacular Sunday afternoon. I will always have fond memories of my visit to Montreal, and I am certain that the main cause for these filings is the L Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gabu738
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the positive Tripadvisor reviews, and we were glad we did. Location is perfect, as it is only about 5 min (or less) walk to both nearby Metro stations (we didn't have a car), and is close to many tourist attractions. We went with the breakfast package, and while the food was good, the choices could be expanded to some hot food items. The service of the staff was great as well. One of them sensed we wanted to have a picture taken in front fo the LOVE sign, and offered to take the picture for us without us asking. Another helped us carry our luggages to the entrance of the hotel when we left. A couple minor issues: - There is no spare electrical outlet in our room. Everytime I need to recharge my cellphone/camera/etc, I need to unplug something. Somewhat inconvenient. - There doesn't seem to be any ventilation inside the bathroom. As a result, the mirror always fogged up after a shower. A tip: It is less than a 10 min walk to Chinatown. One can purchase good quality pastries at a very good price. The $1 for two egg tarts are especially good deals.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: alysonsmom
Reviews.Content: It was an evening out on the town for my friend and me. L Hotel was an ideal location to spend the night after a late reservation at a nearby restaurant. Standing in line to check in, I was greeted by Nicolas, the hotel's jack-of-all trades, with a bottle of water, a smile, information regarding parking, and a great welcome. All of the staff were attentive and most helpful. The hotel has a wonderful air of elegance but no pompous attitude. The lobby was quite spectacular with the magnificent art pieces. I would definitely stay again and would recommend it to all. If you go, please say bonjours to Nicolas for me. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying in a museum”
Reviews.Author: Franciscoar
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in July 2011 before continuing our trip up to Quebec City, and the hotel is absolutely amazing. There were two original Marc Chagalls on the walls in our room!!!. The entrance hall and corridor were filled with works of art ranging from pictures and drawings of MirÃ³, Andy Warhol, Botero and lots of painters and sculptors, interesting pieces of furniture and photographs. The room was very spacious, with a big flat-screen TV and lots of channels. The bathroom was average, though. As for the staff, they were very nice, really. Location is absolutely great. But LHotel stands out because of its bizarre art collection worth spending a night there or having a drink in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and elegance in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: AGRMAG
Reviews.Content: LHotel was a wonderful surprise for us! The photos and reviews are absolutely accurate! Rooms/beds are comfortable, quiet and very well appointed. The hotel lobby is FILLED with amazing art - wonderful place to relax with a glass of wine. The location of the hotel is very central to Old Montreal, the Port, the bike path, good restaurants, Notre Dame. Park your car and walk. Service at the hotel is top-notch - best doormen in the city! All the staff was friendly and helpful. We only ate the continental breakfast one time in the hotel - it is an added cost. Parking is also an added cost. You would expect these costs in a major metropolitan city. I would return to this hotel in a minute, if I was in Montreal again. You have the comfortable feeling of a smaller hotel with an international elegance. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at L'Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmalamud
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at L'Hotel. The artwork was amazing, and the staff was excellent. The location was also terrific for touring Vieux Montreal. I did find the jacuzzi tub/shower a bit difficult to use as a shower since the sides were so high. The hotel was just lovely, though and we would recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryB1429
Reviews.Content: Staff were amazingly attentive; breakfast was great, the rooms were spacious, the art incredible and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “Still basking in the warmth of LHotel”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer351
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at Lhotel and hated to leave. The location was excellent and we took advantage of it by walking for hours through Old Montreal, biking along the Canal, and easily hopping on the Metro to many parts of the city. The staff was amazing! Cynthia was very patient and made wonderful restaurant reservations for us before we arrived. At one romantic restaurant we were seated in a prime window seat, and on our table was a card from the hotel wishing us a Happy Anniversary! When we thanked them on our return to the hotel the very friendly Nicholas treated us to a glass of wine on the house. The staff answered our MANY questions in a very friendly manner, and gave very clear directions to every location we asked about. Our room was very large with high ceilings, and after a long day of touring it felt like home on our return. The bed was very comfortable and the decor was beautiful. The art work throughout the hotel was amazing and we were encouraged to walk on all of the floors and view it all. We enjoyed it better than our trip to the art museum! Overall, it was a wonderful, warm, and comfortable trip. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a disappointing second visit.”
Reviews.Author: markp30
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this property, the first under its previous name. We were in Montreal for a wedding, so only stayed two nights. Overall, it was a good hotel, but didn't really leave us wanting to return a third time. Strengths: This hotel is in an excellent location. It's convenient by foot or metro to all of central Montreal, with many nearby shops and restaurants. The service provided by the hotel staff was very good. We were greeted by friendly front desk staff in both languages. The decor of the common areas is great - very eclectic, mixing antiques and pop art. Definitely enjoyable. We also really liked the bathroom in our room. It was clean, functional, well styled and the toiletries were very nice. Weaknesses: Our room felt much more tired than during our last visit. The chair was ripped with stuffing poking out the edge, and there was a prominent iron burn-mark in the carpeting. We ordered a cheese plate to our room one afternoon and were disappointed. It consisted of a cheddar, swiss and a brie - clearly all of the grocery store variety. Quebec has such lovely cheeses to offer, but this was an embarrassment. Evidently the management agreed, since we weren't charged for the food. And finally, the bed. Perhaps two of the worst nights of sleep we've had all year. Not much more can be said about that. Ultimately, I think we'll check out another place for the next time we're in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Way Cool spot we loved a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Randi Sue Q
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, & wonderful service in an extraordinary hotel environment. Lovely warm lobby with live bossa-nova music , a nice bar and impressive art. The rooms are charming, comfy,& with beautifully design antique furniture. Formerly an 18 century bank , each room is slightly different with some elegant remnants of its bank days:( suite 318 is the old vault. renovated) The art throughout the halls are worthy of any Contemporary or Modern art museum. We look forward to a return visit to Montreal and to the charming L Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...eclectic, artsy”
Reviews.Author: Joanna1661
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, exremely accomodating, friendly and courteous. I would stay here again! The room was spotless. The staff went beyond the call of duty to assist us and make our stay in Montreal easier. Definitely A+!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Montreal Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Apey-NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ L'Hotel (formerly Hotel 19th Century) with teenager last week. " King Suite " for $270/nt with b'fast included (which was excellent, if a little limited). Room was enormous, clean, quiet. Refrig., free WiFi, work desk, Hermes toiletries among the perks. Seldom have had a better room in decades of traveling. Hotel changed from 19th century period feel to now modern art feel. Owned by Guess Jeans founder - furnished with their art collection. In historic old bldg. Staff helpful, friendly, happy to engage you in english, if that's what you need. Location is perfect - on Northern edge of Vieux (old) Montreal, with easy access to that area + (subway 5 min. away - Place D'Arms) all areas further North that you're going to want to go to as well. Can't imagine that for < $300 there's a better place to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel with a few caveats . . .”
Reviews.Author: kidtraveler2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in this fun, artsy, and extremely comfortable boutique hotel. After walking around and passing the other hotels we had looked at online, I am convinced that this is the best locations in Old Montreal, as it is an easy walk to all of Old Montreal but also a skip away from the Metro to explore other parts of the city. The beds were comfortable, rooms were nicely furnished, spacious, and very clean for an older hotel. They offered a healthy continental breakfast that was perfect considering all of the rich food that came later in the day. The amazing art collection on display throughout the hotel is something my husband is still glowing about. The downside to this otherwise exceptional hotel was the service we experienced. First, we had reserved an executive king suite overlooking the street (on the phone directly with the hotel), and when we arrived they told us that there weren't any left. They put us in a queen suite facing the interior courtyard,. They did comp breakfast. The next morning we requested that they deliver a DVD player to our room before lunchtime so we could watch our wedding video as we rested. We had to ask a second time in the late afternoon. The girls at the desk that afternoon sent us to a terrible restaurant (a Greek restaurant on King Arhur, I believe). They gave us terrible directions to drive to Mount Royal, did not tell us where the parking lots were located or that there were barely noticeable pay kiosks in the lots. All of this would have been extremely helpful. Our car was absolutely filthy when they brought it to us out of valet parking (we could barely see out the windows) and the valet simply shrugged and offered a barely audible "sorry." They sent us to the wrong pier for the classic boat show (about a 15 minute walk and the opposite direction from where it was). Then the morning we checked out, they told us to go enjoy breakfast and they would retrieve our car and load our bags. They had difficulty finding our keys (it took about 5 minutes), then they waved us on our way with a smile. Thank goodness my husband thought to check the trunk before we pulled away because it was empty! They were extremely embarassed and apologized profusely (as they did throughout our stay). A few other minor inconviences (i.e. coffee cups that did not fit the lids which resulted in spilling my coffee all over my slacks). A comedy of errors perhaps. My overall sense is that the extemely young staff simply didn't have much experience in and around Montreal and did not have much first-hand knowledge of the city. I'm assuming the girls had never been to Mount Royal or dined in any of the ethnic restaurants that we wanted to experience. One gentleman, Francois, was extremely helpful during our stay and seemed to have more knowledge than the rest of them combined. Thank you Francois! We will return to this hotel for many reasons (the charm, the art, the location), but will do our own research and find recommendations for dining and playing before we arrive at the hotel. We have travelled around the world and this could have been one of our better hotel experiences. Management, please re-train your staff and educate them on the city, and this little gem could be truly amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway....All thanks to Lhotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2TRAVEL64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to this wonderful hotel for our 9 year anniversary and we couldn't have asked for a better place to celebrate. The hotel is located in Old Montreal where you have to remind yourself at times that you are in Montreal and not in Paris!! The rooms are impeccable and the beds are super comfy. The staff were very attentive and very friendly.....would love to encounter this kind of treatment at every hotel we stay at. We ordered room service one night and our food arrived within 15 minutes. The hotel is also very close to some of the most amazing restaurants (Barrocco), outdoor patios, major attractions and bars. Our future visits to Montreal will only be at lhotel so if you are planning a trip to Montreal with a preference to Old Montreal, this is the place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: ktkat59
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travellers and look to the trip advisor for before booking any hotels. We had a executive king room and it was very large with a well equipped bathroom. The beds were very comfortable. The best part was the service which exceeded our expectations. The location to old Montreal is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Art Museum and Modern Hotel ... all in one”
Reviews.Author: linnyd1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this gorgeous small boutique hotel for three days. The staff were excellent. The decor was colourful. artistic, contemporary, fashionable, and pleasing to the eye. The position was convenient and within walking distance to the port for boat cruise, the restaurant district, the funky cosmopolitan shops, the tourist haven, and central business district. The breakfast was delicious with plenty of fresh food options. We would recommend this hotel to travellers, especially Australians who would appreciate the modern art collection. We would love to stay again ... very soon!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Lhotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoJosOttawa
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, but this is a great little hotel. Super comfy bed and pillows! The basic room is a bit small but charming, clean and tastefully decorated. Location is great to explore le Vieux Montreal. Staff is extremely courteous and helpful. Useful valet parking with in-and-out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect fit!”
Reviews.Author: eof025
Reviews.Content: ...for a family of four with 2 boys. ages 21 & 13. No way was the 21 year old sleeping in the same pull out couch as the 13 yr. old! The hotel room was spacious, with a king bed, pull- out and a roll away, absolutely perfect. The bathroom, however, was small. The staff was outstanding in every way, making reservations for dinner and offering suggestions for activities. The bar, however, was overpriced and under used. We went to XO at the St. James instead. Art work was exceptional throughout the hotel and well worth seeing. Great location, convenient to all of Old Montreal and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the wine and proximity to everything...fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to LHotel and our bar server was amazing... Great wine and evening ambiance. Personalized service was superb. This hotel was amazing... Art on every wall. Cheers Margaret and Darryl

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Doug89
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and the staff could not do enough for our family.Reccomended and booked excellent restaurants.Purchased flowers for our Mom's memorial service and saw to all our needs while we were there.the hotel itself was beautiful and central to old Montreal.Would definetely return there when in Montreal again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisbeth022
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lhotel with a friend on our first trip to Montreal. What an amazing place! The location is perfect, the art displayed throughout the hotel is truly incredible, our room was lovely, and most of all, the front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. A special thanks to Nicholas for his extraordinary hospitality the last night of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: RachelleRN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 10th anniversary and were pleased to find that they had upgraded our room to a Queen Suite. We're not usually accustomed to the suite-type rooms and so we were both like little kids jumping on the bed with excitement when we entered our room. It was beautifully furnished, elegant, stylish, large and clean. The bed was super comfortable and we had a fridge too. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating...even for my husband who didn't speak french. We were located right in old Montreal and within walking distance to all the shops, Notre Dame Basilica, cafes, restaurants, horse drawn carriage rides etc. I can only speak for the Suite, but I'm certain that all the rooms were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “rememberance trip for 6 siblings”
Reviews.Author: Judy P
Reviews.Content: My 5 siblings and I went to Montreal to to fulfill our 92 year old mother's wish to be buried beside our father.We were greeted by the staff with a cold bottle of water after a long drive from Toronto. Our rooms were more than we expected.The service was also above our expectations.........they ordered flowers for us to take to the grave and supplied bandaids when I injured my toe.After an evening out at one of the amazing restaurants nearby in Old Montreal we sat having a glass of wine in the attractive art filled lobby and Nicholas brought in a platter of cheese to go along with our drinks.Everyone was so friendly and we felt as though we were staying in a private home.Next time I go to Montreal with my husband , I know where we'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfamily287
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at L'hotel as we headed back to Toronto froma week touring Quebec. The staff at the hotel were terrific. We asked for their advice about restaurants and they not only had great advice about places to eat but they happily called the restaurant and made a reservation. The front desk staff and breakfast room staff were great. Our room was terrific. A large room with very high ceilings, clean and nicely decorated. The art work hung on all of the walls in every hallway makes the hotel as much a gallerey as it is a hotel. Finally, the location next to Vieux Montreal is great to access all that Montreal has to offer. We will definately be back to L'hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the art & nice, big room”
Reviews.Author: jslatch
Reviews.Content: The art collection in this place was amazing. A real treat to walk around, looking at the paintings and sculptures. The service was great, even offering (with my permission) lollipops to my sons upon our arrival. The room was very spacious and was tastefully appointed. Breakfast was continental but nice, with attentive service. Location was very convenient, although more in the business district... but very close to the historical section. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: Gielant
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous. The staff is gorgeous. Our room was gorgeous. Getting the picture? Service was excellent and highly personable. The location is perfect. The abundance of art and the eye for design is incredible. We want to live there! : ) Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Irish8th
Reviews.Content: Out of our taxi and up the steps of the L Hotel, the first thing I heard was, "There you are!" This from the front desk clerk. It was so refreshing and welcoming. We stayed 6 nights and what struck us most - besides the plentiful art and comfortable rooms - was the service. There are a lot of employees at every turn and always saying hello and what can I do for you. Or just handing you bottles of water or fresh towels without asking. There were always a couple of young guys waiting at the top of the stairs, yet they didn't have an officious presence, they joked with each other, but were attentive the moment they saw you. The whole place had a relaxed, friendly vibe - this was something I've never experienced at a hotel before. The breakfast was also excellent - healthy choices and served in a cheerful room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunbrook
Reviews.Content: Lhotel is centrally located in old Montreal. Outstanding accomodations as well as very friendly and helpful staff. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “TREATED LIKE FAMILY”
Reviews.Author: TravelPo11
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at LHotel and had a great time. The hotel is rather unique. The works of famous artists are on the walls throughout the hotel. It was like staying at a museum. We stayed in Room 115 and it was huge. The room had a great window seat and I spent the evenings watching the people go by and had a great view of the lightening storm that occurred one night. I can't say enough about the staff. They all seem to love to work there and were extremely helpful and personable. They just made us feel so comfortable. We were there during record-breaking, oppressive heat but the staff kept a sense of humor about the whole thing which made it more bearable for us. When we left for home, the two women at the desk helped us lug our luggage out to the cab. One suitcase was very heavy and almost the size of the clerk but she hoisted it down the stairs and into the trunk. They wished us a safe trip and began to rush away when I tried to tip them. They were surprised at the gesture, so I know they did not go to all that trouble for a tip. The location is great. It is just a block away from the Basilica and two blocks from the main area of Vieux Montreal. The hotel is also very close to the Metro. Even with the heat it was an enjoyable stay at the LHotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SuzWilkinson
Reviews.Content: NOTE: it used to be called Hotel XIX/Xixe Siecle This place is awesome. It's in a great location, 5 minutes walk from Old Montrealâ€™s sights like the Basilica and itâ€™s also across the road from Hotel Le-St James where you can star spot (the paparazzi were camped out for U2 while we were there). Parking is $22 for 24 hours pre tax which is a hideous 14%. We enjoyed costly drinks while watching a live Bossa Nova trio on Friday night. For nightlife, there are many bars and clubs in Old Montreal and if you're looking for something cool and interesting you should try finding the Velvet Lounge Speakeasy. As you enter LHotel it shamelessly promotes its brand with â€˜LHâ€™ and â€˜LOVEâ€™ mugs and other paraphernalia yet it doesnâ€™t seem at all cheap. Staff were professional yet friendly. Rather than the usual boring decor, they have modern art all around â€“ Jasper Johns, Miro, local artists and more adorn the halls and several of the rooms are themed. The rooms are large with nicely appointed bathrooms. I booked 2 rooms for 2 nights, they were both the same size even though one had a king and the other had 2 queens. Only the king room had a fridge. As a frivolous aside, I loved their Gilchrist and Soames soap (mint exfoliating bar).

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: misfitman
Reviews.Content: Booked the L Hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor for my family's first visit to Montreal. What a treat! We stayed for 4 nights in a Junior Suite, the room was beautiul and spacious, full of artwork, confortable king bed and a sofa hide-a-bed for our son. The hotel was charming and unique, with a very helpful and friendly service staff. We especially enjoyed the small lobby bar that offered live music for happy hour and some great wine choices athough pricey. Nicolas who worked the bar was a gracious host, shared the history of the hotel with us and helped us with questions about the city. We thought the location was perfect, just two blocks from the Metro, around the corner from Old Montreal, the waterfront, and may choices of restaurants. I almost never go back to the same hotel as I like to experience new and different hotel properties, but after this great stay I changed my reservation for our overnite stay on the way back from Quebec City to the Montreal airport to stay another night at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay while visiting Old Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: skootdoot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our children (ages 19-25) stayed at L'Hotel for a weekend trip to Old Montreal. My husband and I had been to Montreal previously, but this was the first experience for our grown children. We went to see a Cirque du Soleil performance at the old port, so we wanted a hotel close by within walking distance. The reviews through Tripadvisor were helpful in making the decision to stay a L'Hotel and they were right on (at least the posititive ones). The rooms were large and very clean, loved the high ceilings, the bathroom was nice, granite countertop, etc - the only issue with the bathroom was the handle in the shower kept falling off. The artwork throughout the entire hotel was fun to look at and provided an interesting decor. The breakfast at the hotel was simple but very good (fresh fruit, croissants, pastry, coffee, juice) no complaints whatsoever. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - parking at the hotel was $22 per day, but we expected that. If pressed to point out a negative I would have to say that because we arrived to Montreal early, I had requested an early check-in, but the hotel was unable to accomodate us. We loved our stay and this hotel and really enjoyed walking all around the old city. St. Paul street with all the shops and galleries are wonderful! Cirque was amazing!! Can't wait to visit again and we would definately stay at this hotel again. One HUGE drawback to visiting Montreal is how expensive it is and how you are taxed and taxed and taxed again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is okay but rooms are not as shown online.”
Reviews.Author: kathyc771
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a family vacation based on the reviews and the hotel pictures. i was very disappointed in our room. it did not look at all like the pictures on their website. our room was dated, drab and very outdated, The carpet was worn and had burn marks on several areas of the floor, The room was very musty and the humidity was extremely high. No fans in the room (inclding the bath), We drove 15 hours to get here and we were so tired that i didn't complain when we got there. I wish I would have requested a new room because the hotel is nice overall but the room was horrible, and I really didn't enjoy any time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT,GREAT”
Reviews.Author: dabronx1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The hotel is easy to find and is located in a good neighborhood. The room I stayed in was large and had very high ceilings. Everything in the room worked perfectly and if there was someting I needed the staff had it for me very quickly. The Staff.... the staff at this hotel is top notch. Everyone was super friendly and eager to help out with directions or suggestions. If you like art the hotel has tons of pieces throughout the location. I will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGuys
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed 7 nights at L'Hotel in Montreal. The service was impeccable, the rooms very comfortable, the staff very attentive and hospitable, and the location was perfect. The artwork contained within the hotel put the Museum of Contemporary Art to shame! If you are traveling to Montreal, this is the hotel to stay at. Friday and Saturday evening had a bosso nova group in the bar area...a great place to have a glass or two of wine and listen to some great music.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: MJC82
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel and perfect location in old montreal.Very friendly and helpful staff.Rooms are unique ,comfortable and if you appreciate modern art its like staying in an art gallery.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate”
Reviews.Author: Borisrocks
Reviews.Content: What an experience! The hotel contains a private collection of contemporary art in corridors and rooms. It's out of this world. The rooms are elegant, very roomy, extremely comfortable and sound-insulated. All employees are young, however very experienced and personable. Breakfast (continental) is served in a classy dining room, offering a healthy choice of items. The location is excellent, right in Old Town, within steps from The Notre-Dame Basilica, Rue St.Paul (restaurants and shops) and the St.Lawrence river.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mytwocents2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and just returned home today. From the moment we arrived the staff was helpful and pleasant! Our suite unfortunately had a problem with the air conditioning, and after two attempts at a technician trying to fix it, we decided to ask for a new room (fyi: temps were in high 80's). The hotel was AWESOME, upgrading us immediately to a KING SUITE which took my breath away (with of course no extra charge). They offered my husband and I a complimentary drink at the bar as well! (We did take advantage and prior to heading out for a night on the town, we ordered our comp. drinks) One tiny negative was that if you chose to hang out at the bar or even buy just a drink, plan on sticker shock at the prices ($16 per glass of wine!!!!) GLAD it was complimentary! Ok... what else... the staff was so helpful with any/all questions and I kid you not, one of the attendents was so excited for us to try l'sommaire restaurant that he literally walked us there and told us awesome "fun facts" about some historical details of Old Montreal (eg. 1st ever phone call on the telephone came from 262 St. Jacques.... the site of the hotel). Random sidenote: They did not mention that located near the fitness room there is also a computer for open use (stumbled upon it checking out the downstairs). The owner of the hotel (George Marciano, creator of Guess Jeans) was there all weekend and was spotted in the lounge often! This hotel is in the PERFECT location, 2 minutes exactly to TWO different Metro entrances. Ask the staff for a small metro map, it was really handy! Noise each night was a bit loud out front but it was mainly due to U2 being guests at the hotel on the corner, fans lined the corners day and night looking to catch a glimpse! Right across the street is a small cafe, we decided to go cheap for breakfast and they have croissants, muffins, OJ, coffee etc... $12 for two of us and we were off! The hotel also have complimentary bottled water, by request, grab one/two before sightseeing for the day, b/c otherwise everywhere else they are around $3. They also provided toothpaste upon request, when we ran out.... I would recommend this place in a heartbeat and would undoubtedly return.. Other review mentioned smell in lounge (perfume or something like freshener), it did not bother me whatsoever, but my hubby mentioned it a time or two. It smells romantic... at least that's what I told him :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: abcdef999
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel with a unique flair and I think the hotel photos give you a sense of that. Great location on edge of Old Montreal but not in the middle of it. For us, it provided easy access to Old Montreal, as well as reasonable access to Jazzfest near St. Catherines. Hotel was clean and safe. Rooms are a little tight but have high ceilings. Views not great but if you are hanging out in your room, you are missing a lot of great things to see. A city bike rack is very close to the front of the hotel - it gave us an awesome, cheap way to explore the city. If you are looking for a comfortable well-located home while you explore the city, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, especially for contemporary art lovers”
Reviews.Author: billrosenblatt
Reviews.Content: This is a classy 4-star hotel in the old financial district, between the Convention Center and the Old City. The rooms are very pleasant and the service is friendly. But the killer aspect of LHotel is the world-class collection of contemporary artworks just hanging on the wall everywhere - in the hallways and rooms. Warhols, Lichtensteins, Rauschenbergs, Stellas, Rosenquists, Chagalls, Miros, the list goes on and on. It is supposedly the largest private contemporary art collection in North America. Just wander the hallways; it's better than any museum in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel stays ever.”
Reviews.Author: whereisdave
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic- although honestly Old Montreal and Downtown is very walkable in general. About a 5min walk north to Palace de Congress, and that is also where the Westin and Renaissance are located. About another 5min to the metro stop. Less than 5min east to Plaza de Arms. About 10min gets you at the ferry docksand Science or Archeology museums. From the 747 airport bus drop off (8$, there is a ticket machine that makes change now) it is about 15min walk dragging your luggage through the Chinatown area and past some homeless, but they don't trouble you at all. Taxi ride back to airport cost 38$ and without traffic was 20min. There was always a front desk staff of about three people, never a wait. Spoke perfect English, and with their accents I believe perfect French as well. Extremely welcoming, patiently answered every question and with a smile, assisted with restaurant reservations. Coming in the door they would typically welcome me with a free bottle of cold water. Check in/check out was immediate and flawless. Room 206 was large and spotless, extremely high ceiling. Free wireless internet extremely fast and easy to connect. Bed extremely comfortable. Curtains would black out sunlight. Mini fridge in the room, LCD TV. Air conditioning worked perfectly and was quiet. No special view from my room, off a quiet street. Anything not perfect? Well, the toilet could have a more powerful flush (maybe a Montreal or personal thing?) and the public computer you can use for free to print out airline boarding passes was old and slow. Lighting in the room a little dim. Nothing preventing a 5/excellent rating. Also not the place to stay if you are looking for a big bar or pool scene. I did not try the breakfast or any type of room service. I was originally going to stay at the Auberge du Vieux Port (which seemed very nice) but I saved over $40/night by choosing the LHotel. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends. Oh yeah, they had some pretty cool artwork hung everywhere too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bookish42
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the staff at L'Hotel. Everyone I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. My room faced a small side street and was very quiet. The room was huge but the way it was decorated didn't really make good use of its size -- not enough furniture for the space and dim lighting, with a small bathroom. I wish they had in-room coffee makers. But those are minor issues -- overall the stay was very pleasant. And I loved the art-lined hallways.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DennisBNYC
Reviews.Content: LHotel in Montreal is one of those great hotels; just the right size, extremely helpful and friendly staff, spacious clean rooms, ideal location, etc. etc. I would not hesitate to either return or to recommend it highly. The museum is also a modern art museum, literally. The owner has amassed an amazing collection of modern art and uses this hotel to display it; on every wall and every bit of free space, creating a fascinating environment. My girlfriend and I recently spent 4 nights at LHotel and plan to return on our next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, interesting artwork, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bobinlakeway
Reviews.Content: This hotel in old Montreal was unique. It features copies of modern art and sculpture in its lobby and along its hallways. Our room was on the first floor in the rear which was on the street and was a little noisy. The room itself had a 12 foot ceiling and was quite roomy. It was nicely appointed. The breakfast that was included in the rate I paid was very generous with juices, fruit, bread, yogurt, cereal. You were seated at a table and a waitress brought coffee. The hotel is one block from the basilica. While there's a bar in the lobby, no one was using it. There are a lot of restaurants in the area. One that was quite good was Boris Bistro.

Reviews.Title: “My Best Hotel Experience ..Ever, Bar none !!!..Staff made it Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: donnaATL
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time in Montreal, and I cannot wait to return. The staff @ L'hotel made this a memorable experience, that I would like to repeat. Thanks to Nicholas, Mylene, Laura, David, Cynthia , Francois, Daniel, my maid, and all who were always so kind and helpful to us... My colleague & I were on a business trip, and every night when we returned to hotel, they made us feel like we were coming home.They treated us like family, (Good ones !!).really By the end of our stay, I felt that we really had made new friends... Service was "above & beyond".. Too numerous to list here.....I stayed in the Chagall Chambre (Marc, Chagall artist).. It was lovely, 2 Chagalls, High ceilings , well appointed... A refrigerator in room was a real plus... The location, is unbeatable; 2 blocks from Basilique Notre Dame 2 blocks to the Palais de Congress (our meeting location), and walking distance to the old city, waterfront port and fine art district.There is a metro station close by to use to take to downtown and the Musee des Beaux arts... This is a boutique hotel, and as such does not have a full spa,, But it has a small exercise center, business center.., and a lovely intimate hotel bar..Nicholas suggested that we get a drink, and do a sel-f guided tour of all the art work on the hotel floors.. We did this one night, and it was like being in art galleyr. It was a lovely way wind down after meetings before going to dinner.The art makes this a truly unique, "do not miss" hotel....But again, it was the staff that I would come back to see..All staff was Enthusiastic, friendly, caring, helpful, and patient in every way... A bientot, mes amis,...Nous nous souviendrons de vous et votre aimable. ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly & Help Staff”
Reviews.Author: amotch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, the environment was cool, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. If you're into art, you'll love the large collection they have in the lobby and hallways. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, and the ceilings were nice and high! It wasn't far from Vieux Montreal, one of the most popular tourist destinations. Should we be back, LHotel will definitely be on our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stevenrma
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect for us as we wanted to explore the old town section of Montreal. The subway was a short walk away as well. The room was just okay and the housekeeping and front desk were not in sync (front desk said room was ready - room was being serviced!). I would go there again but I might look around first as there were other options in that area. The hotel was clean, centrally located and upscale but lacked communication and convenient parking (valet or self park garage).

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: realgem1
Reviews.Content: I usually spend upward of 10-12 hours doing hotel research when I go to a new city. I love boutique hotels and this lives up to my high standards. Wonderful staff and the art is amazing! Apparently one of the largest private collections in Canada! Easy walk to St Catherine's Street for Shopping and Rue St. Paul for a delightful pedestrian area. Both of which are a must see!!! Don't worry if you don't speak French it is not necessary... Everyone speaks English. Enjoy only thing is no irons in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre value unless you want to stay in an art museum”
Reviews.Author: AdDextra
Reviews.Content: Formerly the Hotel XIX Siecle, Lhotel was renovated in 2010 and re-opened, as one of the staff explained to us, by the owner of 'Guess' jeans as a place to put 'the largest art collection in North America.' There is art all over the place, and if this is your kind of thing, it may be worth the premium you'll pay to stay there -- but if not, the hotel itself is a decent but not great place to stay. The location in Old Montreal is very convenient to the (very expensive) shops, restaurants, and bars on Rue St Paul and Rue de la Commune, but also to two subway stops (Square Victoria & Place d'Armes) for access to the rest of the city. A great part of town to be in if you don't mind spending some money or want to be out late -- even in the middle of the week, many of the bars were open a lot later than we were, so this might improve the 'value' part of the equation for the right set. But it's tough to justify the price for the hotel itself: the decor (including some of the art) is very modern and in some cases downright tacky. Our 'Superiore' room (the least expensive) was very small, though mostly still quite comfortable.
