The bed seemed very much on the small side for a Queen and was adequate but not especially comfortable. The view was the parking lot and dilapidated building next door, though a lot of Old Montreal is like that -- beautiful buildings on one block and run-down buildings with 'a louer' (for rent) signs the next. The exception to the value is the staff, all of whom were tremendously helpful and friendly during our 4-night stay. We didn't need a whole heck of a lot but found everyone from the doorman to the concierge a pleasure to talk to. So even if the hotel gave us the impression that it was a little too cool for us, the staff made up for it. Not a bad place but I'd look for somewhere in a slightly less glamorous neighborhood like Mont-Royal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully creative, arty, stylish and very pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AB841989
Reviews.Content: I stayed in L Hotel (note the absence of an apostrophe) in Montreal for one week in May '11. What a wonderful experience. This very affordable hotel is like nothing I've ever seen before and I've stayed in a thousand hotels on my business trips abroad. It is comfortable, spotlessly clean, sophisticated yet very homely. The collection of artwork that is displayed is simply amazing and will grasp the immediate attention of anyone with a love of art. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly (especially Nicholas the Bartender who could not do enough for us to make our visit to Montreal just perfect - he is a true gem). I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for all it has to offer and more. Marks out of 10? A big fat 10!!!! Congratulations to all tte staff at L Hotel for a wonderful experience :-) Alan, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbone91148
Reviews.Content: It is hard to describe the incredible weekend experience we shared with the wonderful people who staff LHotel. The hotel itself was charming with many personal works of art on every part of every wall and every hallway. But the positive energy from the staff to provide such a high level of service was amazing. You could sense they were empowered to attend to each guest as family and create an amazing experience for every individual. When we wondered if we should take an umbrella to dinner they offered to bring us one on our return from a local restaurant if it rained !!! Many thanks to Mylene, Francois, and especially Nicholas for your help in our first time to Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JohnInVirginia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights with my family in April. Really a fantastic hotel. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful, the location is perfect, breakfast was excellent and varied just enough every day to keep it interesting, and the room was quite comfortable. I would absolutely stay here again on any future trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty comfortable and convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: RobertTheRed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011 for 5 nights to attend a conference at the Palais des congres (convention center) which is only about 2 blocks away -- very convenient. Rooms are comfortable and pretty quiet. The only drawback from my point of view was that I was explicitly told when I checked in that breakfast was included, but that turned out not to be the case and nothing could be done about it. This was pretty annoying for a while, but wasn't so bad in the scheme of things. But if you are told this, get it in writing! Otherwise, don't bother with the breakfast, which is just a cold buffet. There is a computer downstairs for printing out your boarding pass. The free WiFi worked OK -- about 3 Mbits/sec download speed in my room. Lots of restaurants and bars on Rue St Paul, about 3-4 block towards the river.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and More”
Reviews.Author: Susan1456
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a wonderful location on the edge of the Old City. We walked between the Old and New all in one day and had a great time. The rooms are very large and have the 16 foot ceilings. The bathrooms have both a large Jacuzzi bathtub and a shower stall. The bedroom area has a "living room" feel to them. The only thing that is missing is the fireplace. We were met at the curb to check in and even though you have to Valet Park your car, they don't mind getting it for you as often as you like. All needs were taken care of promptly and we left our bags at the front desk after check out and they allowed us to keep the car there also even though we left the city after 6pm. Everyone was courteous, helpful and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: futrinka
Reviews.Content: It is a great place to stay for business! The hotel is close to the Palais de Congrais, where the conference I attended took place. You have fast internet connection, convenient room with fridge, comfortable bed! The old port is nearby, which is a perfect place for morning running. The breakfast was not so diverse like in Europe but for me OK (fruits, cereals, few types of pastries, bread, 1 type of ham, 3 types of cheese, jams etc.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hotel is the only place to stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: ncrist
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week-end in Montreal with friends to celebrate my 50th birthday. One of the many highlights of the week-end was the great hotel that we stayed in--L'Hotel in Old Montreal. From the moment we pulled up in our cab, we had a fantastic experience there. The staff runs out to meet you and welcome you in. Everyone is incredibly nice and happy--it is really unlike any other hotel experience I've ever had. Melanie had great recommendations for our evenings out and Nicholas was an incredible jack of all trades--part bartender, part host and a great guy to talk to. The hotel is owned by Georges Marciano (Guess jeans) and the lobby and corridors are full of signed artists' proofs and lithos of works by artists like Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein and Robert Indiana that add to the fun atmosphere. In fact, the "LOVE" sculpture by Robert Indiana is outside the hotel, which is quite apt because you are going to LOVE this hotel. It almost seems like an afterthought to mention that the rooms are nicely sized and the beds are really comfortable. I would not consider staying anywhere else the next time I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful accomodations and super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: matthewcbrand
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for one night at this wonderful hotel in Old Montreal. It's in a perfect location to be able to access Old Montreal, and also very close to Chinatown, the Latin Quater, and downtown. It's in a very artistic area, very close to the Notre Dame Cathedral. The room was big with high ceilings, everything was nice and clean. And the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Marisaeb
Reviews.Content: The staff were, across the board, the nicest and friendliest people I've encountered ever in a service establishment. They went above & beyond to make my stay excellent. The rooms were superb, the art made it feel like a gallery, the hotel was quiet, and I will most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “The MOST BEAUTIFUL room I have ever seen or stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Julie984025
Reviews.Content: This was by far the MOST BEAUTIFUL room I have ever seen or stayed in. I would like to precise that I travel a lot and have been to MontrÃ©al many many times and always stayed at different hotels like the Hyatt, the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth, the Marriott, etc. For the purpose of my trip, I wanted a special room without paying a $1000.00. I didnâ€™t want a regular hotel room and I can guarantee you that I hit the jackpot. I was in room 203 called Suite Roy Lichtenstein. At first I didnâ€™t want to unpack because I was positive I was in the wrong room. I couldnâ€™t believe that the room I was assigned to, was ours ($240 February 2011) so I went back to the reception to clarify the situation. At my greatest surprise, I was re-assured that I was indeed in the room I had reserved. The room was very spacious and with its 12â€™ ceiling it makes it look ever bigger. When you get in the room, there is a foyer entrance about 8 x 10, then you pass 2 french doors into the living room. In the 10 x 18 living room, you have a sofa bed, a chair and a desk. Again you walk through french doors where it gets you to the bedroom. In the bedroom you have a ceiling chandelier, a fireplace, a flat screen tv, 2 night tables and a dresser. This room is located in a corner of the building so the bedroom is decorated with 4 tall beautiful windows draped with curtains from ceiling to floor. All the furniture is well appointed. This is the best quality/price you will ever find. The only thing that was missing was a crown on top of my head because I really felt like a Queen. Thank you LHotel for making my stay such a remarkable one. I will definitely go back. Rest assure that I will tell all my friends that I found my little heaven on earth. Continental breakfast â€“ The most luxurious continental breakfast everâ€¦..in a beautiful dinning room * Fresh cut fruits * Freshly pressed juices, water bottles * Cheese * Hard boiled eggs, stuffed eggs * Cold cuts * Muffins, hot croissant, toasts, bagels Lobby / Bar â€“ Very cozy with love seats and chairs Staff â€“ Polite, friendly and very helpful Parking (indoor with in & out privileges) $22.00 per 24hrs â€“ Valet parking included in the priceâ€¦tip is optional Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff is exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Granville25
Reviews.Content: Nicely located for historical sightseeing. Continental breakfast was lovely. Room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The art in the hotel was a real bonus. Every staff member was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"LHOTEL" Brings the term "Boutique Hotel" to a higher Level”
Reviews.Author: RemoLuck09
Reviews.Content: I arrived with NO EXPEXTATIONS , and was quickly amazed by the service that the porters (Daniel and Nick ) inflicted with kindnest and professionalism that not only took my luggages but brought me a bottle water , and offered me a expresso while i was waitting to check in, all this felt as all my life problems went away, i knew then that i made the right choice for my vacation in Montreal. The guest rooms were ample with charming decor; Rod iron and brass, polished woods and beveled glass and unbelivable art collection in the walk in area brings charm to this Hidden Treasure in Montreal, Fresh plants and a collection of original Art abounding on each floor; Cozy bathrooms and showers. As i sat in the Lobby area to make a call, i noticed The spirited staff welcomed each Guest With Genuine Smiles , what A delight to see enthousiastic and warm employees , enjoying ther work, and making sure they're Guests felt welcomed and relaxed, Kudos to whoever hired them . The name, LHOTEL you must wonder, SAYS IT ALL, Its THE "Boutique"HOTEL in Montreal you must stay at. Yes, stay for awhile, and soon you will feel, That enchantment resides, long after, "Farewell." Merci for a great trip , service and Triple A hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: bixto
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. halfway between my conference center (Hilton Bonaventure) and Old Port (with great restaurants). The art is real. As an Art Historian, I really appreciated being able to examine up close some Warhols, Lichtensteins, Stellas, Rauschenbergs, etc. Some hotels claim to be art hotels, but none are like this one. Charming staff, really helpful, nicely-sized room. Great price. Not one complaint. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay hotel in Montreal for art lovers”
Reviews.Author: Julia155004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. It is worth staying at this hotel just for the art collection: The lobby and every floor is decorated with pieces from the owner's collection of contemporary art by Andy Warhol, Roy Leichenstein, Frank Stella, and Robert Indianna, and many others. The art at this hotel is on par with MOMA in New York city (no exaggeration). The atmosphere is bright, colourful, inspiring, yet unpretentious, laid-back, calm and relaxing at the same time. The staff is really friendly. I had a long chat with Nicholas at the bar, who told me about the history of the bar, the owner (one of the founders of Guess Jeans). The rooms were really nice, with high ceilings, comfy beds, and were impeccably clean. It was quiet, and I had a really good night's sleep. It's also in a good location, right in the heart of Old Montreal. The price is very reasonable for the quality of the hotel. It's probably a good time to go, because I'm sure the prices are going to go way up over the next couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Art Attack - it's like I died and went to heaven!”
Reviews.Author: joethephoenix
Reviews.Content: If you like art, you might enjoy staying here; if you love art - especially Modern Art - you have to stay here! I discovered L'Hotel quite by accident while exploring Old Montreal last January. The Botero and Dine sculptures which frame the entrance to this beautiful 19th-century former bank building aroused my curiosity . After my second champagne cocktail in the lobby bar I knew I had to spend the weekend in this beautiful space before returning home to Toronto. The staff - young, hip and cool - made my stay very pleasant. From check-in to check-out, the service throughout the hotel was attentive, very friendly and most helpful. (A special thanks to Danielle, Francois, Mylene, Nikolaus and Raphaele!) The room was very large and inviting - 12-foot ceilings, (faux?) antiques, 50" LCD television with large original abstract canvases gracing two walls. The king-size bed was firm, with crisp linens. The bathroom was Deco-inspired - a study in black-and-white. The breakfast room had the ambience of a latticed conservatory. The buffet breakfast was very good and the service staff welcoming. (Breakfast was an additional $20 charge - no complaints here.) But really - all of what I have just reported is secondary to The Main Event: the multi-million dollar collection of Modern Art - mostly Pop Art - that graces all of the public rooms and corridors - more than 200 original works on permanent display. If you ever imagined what it would be like to sleep inside MoMA or the Tate Modern - here's your chance to find out. True, many of the works would benefit from a larger display venue - but this is a small boutique hotel we're talking about. These works surround you, enfold you, inspire you. Frankly, I'd have grabbed at the chance to stay here even if sleeping bags were the only beds offered. Did I mention that the room rate for this 4-star accommodation was just $139/nt.Cdn? Thank you M. Marciano (the owner) for sharing these stunning works of art wiith us. Thank you, L'Hotel, for your warm welcome. I look forward to my next stay with you. Au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: JenH21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal, with all the local attractions within walking distance. The hotel is beautiful and it definitely stands out from all the other hotels in the area. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and go that extra mile to ensure you have the best experience. The rooms are large with high ceilings and a good size bathroom. This is the first time that we visited Montreal and staying in this hotel definitely helped to make our valentines day break all that more special. We intend on staying at this hotel again in the future and would recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Elegant and Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real treasure. It is a very short walk from the subway and the restaurants of Old Montreal. The greeting upon our arrival was very warm and we found all staff (Cleaning Lady to Bartender) bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. The lobby is very comfortable with free WiFi. The rooms are elegant with free WiFi and comfortable beds. The bathroom is nice and it and the bedroom were very clean. There was no street noise. We unfortunately had noisy, inconsiderate neighbours the first night however the hotel staff immediately offered to move us. This boutique hotel made our weekend getaway very special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with kind people”
Reviews.Author: BlueDolphin14
Reviews.Content: A hotel that feels like home, surrounded by art pieces. People working their are kind & friendly. Please note that room service does not start before 7 am.

Reviews.Title: “Beware. Prices went way up”
Reviews.Author: Gurgon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on four occasions. The rooms are spacious and fairly well kept, although their age certainly shows. The beds are a little soft for my taste but fairly comfortable. Internet access is spotty depending upon the room you are in. On my last trip to Montreal, I called to book a room as usual and found that they wanted an additional $60 above what I have paid in the past. It's just not worth that much. There are better values within just a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime---from start to finish.”
Reviews.Author: pamlisa
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel in Old Montreal combines the elegance of Old Europe with the charm and friendliness of your neighbourhood haunt. One is treated to a visual feast starting from the architectural beauty and continuing with the impressive, museum quality display of artwork. My partner and I were completely taken with this lovely jewel of a hotel and found it hard to leave. There is a high level of attention to service, and I can't remember the last time I encountered such knowledgeable and welcoming staff--with particular kudos to the concierge and reception desk. Don't miss it on your next trip to Montreal, and be prepared to fall in love.

Reviews.Title: “First time writting a review for a Hotel after 25 years of travelling . Do i need to say anymore? ,WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Abrajonas10
Reviews.Content: This was such a wonderful surprise for my wife and me. We have stayed in about 30 different hotels in Quebec and Montreal over the years, inlcuding places like Le Saint Sulpice, the Nelligan hotel , The Places d' Armes Hotel, And many others in that area, . LHOTEL is just the best of them all. The rooms feel like you are in a comfortable home. The staff bens over backwards trying to fulfill your every need. You would think you paid 1000.00 $ a night for this type of service .( am not kidding ). Everyone had smiles ( not the fake smiles your use to see nowadays ) It is quiet but in a superb location right on In the "Coeur du Vieux port Montreal". , within walking distance to everything.Restaurants, Subway train , , everything is near by , I not only couldn't recommend this hotel any more highly but my wife and I will return here from now on with every visit we make to Montreal. The art on the walls are just "SPECTACULAR" On every floor you will be amazed by this private collection from the owner of the Hotel shares with his guests, Nice job to all the Staff (Mylene at the front desk is just a "Bijou" to talk too )and thanks for a great trip. ( a special Thank you goes out to Nicola with his dynamic personality and Glowing Charm that greeted us like Royalty until the very last second of our stay) .

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, comfort, and supreme guest relations!”
Reviews.Author: Grahamcracker579
Reviews.Content: I haven't yet completed my entire stay at l'hotel, but I am so overwhelmed by my initial experience I felt I must leave a review immediately. The hotel location is perfect, close to major Old Montreal attractions, entrance to the underground and amazing restaurants make a booking a must. But what really elevates this hotel above the gorgeous spacious rooms, down comforters and beautiful art is the amazing guest care from the staff. From curb side to counter, the staff eagerly attends to you every need, even the ones you are not yet aware of. While waiting to check in behind one couple, we were supplied bottle water and warm greetings from every available staff member. Their interactions were genuine and enthusiastic. This hotel clearly understands how to create a home and family away from home. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “It's like sleeping in an art gallery, in a great part of town with considerably friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: EcoMac
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Lhotel for new years eve. Although our stay was only for a few days, the quality of my experience at this hotel in this part of Montreal will keep me going back for years to come. Every aspect about our stay was perfect. Although not modestly cheap hotel, I feel like the price is very reasonable for the quality of stay you receive. The hotel is filled top to bottom with original art, this really gives the hotel its own unique flavour. The rooms are spacious as well as elegant. The beds are very comfortable and the room is very clean. The staff are very helpful, when we were leaving one night they called a cab for us and after we waited for a while they went outside in the rain and personally hailed us a cab. I feel that staying in this hotel in the old part of Montreal is very comforting especially when you are not so familiar with the French language. There are tons of things to do that are all within walking distance or a short drive away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend LHotel for Touring Montreal”
Reviews.Author: gmnrod
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at LHotel (previously Hotel 19th Century) Thanksgiving weekend, for our first visit to Montreal. LHotel was ideally located and easy walking distances to all of Old Montreal (everything within about 1KM radius) and a host of dining options, as well as a short walk to Victoria Square and even St Catherine St for shopping. We had a deluxe superior room at $150 CA per night, comparable to most other hotels in the area. The room was spacious and comfortable. The only drawback (especially being late fall and short days) was that the hotel uses high efficiency flourescent lamp bulbs (admirably) and night time lighting was a bit dim. The staff was exceptional -- friendly, and always helpful. The hotel was quiet and very clean and well kept. The lobby lounge offers a great place to sit and relax. The only disappointment with the lounge is that they did not have a wine list, though did have wine, nor a scotch list, thought they had scotch. The night manager set a price for the wine and a glass of scotch. The Scotch as Macallan 18 yr and $20 per glass, not at all unusual for that Scotch. However, the wine was a California wine (can't even recall the label) that was the only Cabernet available and retails at about $15 US, for which we were charged $65 (and did not see that price until we had the bill). We chalked it up to poor planning on our end, but we are regular wine drinkers and there were two deficiencies here: a scant and poorly selected wine list (nothing of quality available) without clear pricing ahead of time, and in my mind a significantly overpriced wine for a very mediocre (at best) wine. These are things I am responding to the hotel to address, they are easy to remedy with a little attention, and I am sure the hotel can find a reasonable balance on the price of some better (or even this) wine. Overall, I will plan to stay at LHotel again, we loved the staff and location, as well as the comfort of the room., at a price comparable to other large chain hotels that lack the charm of a historic hotel such as this.

Reviews.Title: “A enjoyable experience from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: SWCTmom
Reviews.Content: I chose L'hotel because of the previous Trip Advisor comments, and once again they steered me in the right direction! The location of this hotel is convenient by train, metro or car. Parking is very reasonable at $22 per night and we were offered car retrieval at any time (but we didn't need it since bike and metro services were so close by). Check in was easy and quick, and we were immediately brought up to a clean, bright and quiet room on the 4th floor. The lobby / lounge and every hallway of this hotel is filled with original artwork from Kandinsky to Warhol, which certainly added to our experience. Service at the desk, the front door and the bar was always friendly and helpful. We returned one night from a Canadiens game and were unable to find a restaurant still open for dinner at that hour, so our bartender at the hotel was nice enough to make us a cheese and fruit plate at 11 PM. So nice! The place is a FIND. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall - would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: websterfalls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel XIX Siecle (old name) in April on business. My husband came with me for his first visit to Montreal (he's from France). The first night was a bit noisy as our room was on ground level and we could hear traffic. The room was lovely, but we asked for another room for the rest of our 5 day stay, away from street level. They were very accomodating and gave a better room on the third floor for the rest of the stay with no increase in charge for an upgrade. Beautiful large rooms, very high ceilings, very elegant. Would have liked to have a mini fridge in the room but none available. The continental breakfast was good, service was also very good. The location was fabulous, on the north end of old Montreal so close enough to walk to the office for work but still in a lovely area. We were able to try out several wonderful restaurants in old Montreal each evening and walk around to enjoy the ambiance of the old city. Staff were very friendly and helpful in all aspects, really appreciated their attitudes. They were undergoing renovations when we where there. The gym was down the street (inconvenient) but apparently that was going to change soon by adding a gym. Parking was extra and down the street, but was valet parking no extra charge. No restaurant or room service, just continental breakfast room (included with rate). That didn't really matter with so many great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “strange hotel but overall an enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tlivo
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent 3 nights here during our recent honeymoon in canada. I chose the hotel some months ago before i realised that it had undergone the modern changes. I think i would have preferred it without all the modern art but that is because i like the classic style. The rooms were very clean and attractive and the staff were extremely helpful and polite. I did feel that perhaps there wasn't a great soul to the hotel but i suppose it is early days for it in it's new form. The location was great, our room rate didn't include breakfast, in retrospect i regret not going for the B&B rate. I did enjoy our stay but it did come at a price! (another tip for tourists in montreal - don't go to the sound and light show at the basilica it is dire!!)

Reviews.Title: “Love the art collection at this hotel, staff were very sweet too”
Reviews.Author: leeleefille
Reviews.Content: I moved to L'Hotel for one night after five nights at Le St. Sulpice ( which was full on the Saturday night). I loved the art collection at this hotel. Damien Hirst, Jim Dine, Rosenquist, Sam Francis, Rauschenberg - a truly great representation of some of my favorite American and British artists - and the art adds a whimsical touch to the hotel that I enjoyed. I didn't check out the other floors, but I'll come back to do that on our next trip. Our room was pretty small, but very comfortable and pretty. My favorite thing about the hotel was the breakfast room - a beautifully appointed and elegant room with a great breakfast complete with Montreal bagels (yum!), croissants, fresh fruit, some amazing almond cookies, yogurt etc. The staff working the breakfast worked incredibly hard and were very warm and helpful. The front staff team were great too - not as professional or as experienced as the staff at my first hotel, but they certainly were friendly. The one comment I would make is that our room had a bit of a musty smell - but I was told that they may be renovating the rooms in the near future (and they did have candles for sale in the lobby). I would certainly go back, but would probably splurge for a suite or a larger room. It would be great if the hotel had a restaurant that served lunch and or dinner in addition to breakfast (and my husband is a divine chef who'd love to take on the task!). Definitely a hotel I'd recommend as it's in a great location, has a fun vibe, and is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: LondonRomey
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here and loved it. It's a unique hotel with great artwork, rooms were very spacious, helpful and friendly staff and great location. Just a stone's throw from Old Montreal and a short cab ride from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Close to Old Montreal Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BryonJames
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated hotel. Staff were excellent, rooms comfortable. Breakfast in the dining room was also excellent. Loction was perfect, could walk into old Montreal as well as walk up into the fashion district. A short stroll to wonderful Montreal restraunts. Would highly recommend this hotel for a quiet and romantic getaway. One of the staff even went to a restraunt himself to change our reservations- what service !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool clean hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RIMT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for our first trip to Montreal. From reading guidebooks about the city, we decided we wanted to stay in Old Montreal or Plateau section of town. We picked this hotel because of its kitchsy vibe and location, as well as reasonable rates for a four star hotel. First of all, the basics. The hotel and rooms are extremely clean and well kept. Our room was a bit dark, but that didn't bother us much. Also, the lobby and halls are lined with valubale and interesting works of modern art. This may not appeal to everybody, but for us it was really cool to sleep with an original Roy Lichtenstien and Andy Warhol right outside your door. Furthermore, for a walking city, its in the perfect location. 5 minute walk to old montreal, 15 minutes to St. Catherine (main shopping district), and 25 min to Plateau. We were able to hit all the high points of the city, and amazing restaurants, without taking the car (except for a visit to Mount Royal, which definately requires a car). Some negative points. Parking is ridiculous in that area of town, and the hotel charges $25 per day to use their valet. All they do is park the car in a garage down the street for you. The staff is polite, but not really super friendly or helpful. We learned to ignore their restaurant suggestions after a couple of days. Its better to ask a friendly local for recommendations, as the staff tends to send you to more touristy places. There is also a bar in the lobby, but after a week, my partner and I had no idea when it was open or how to order drinks. And finally, for the price we were charged, we weren't really impressed with the accomodations. One note, there is a tobacco/convenience store half a block from the hotel, run by a Lebanese gentleman named Ibrahim. Super friendly and helpful, knowd exactly where to send your for a more local scene. One word of advice. If you got to a bar or restaurant, avoid the mixed drinks. They are extremely overpriced and watered-down.

Reviews.Title: “Super Chic, Awesome Artwork, but didn't check all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: srochette
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I encourage you to stay here. The location, artwork, and general style of the hotel gives you the feeling of the boutique hotel you are expecting. Notre Dame is right down the street, subway stations are a block or two away, and the sites of old port is a quick walk, a great location to get to just about everything the city has to offer. We arrived at the hotel early not expecting to check in at 11:30am but hoping and prepared to. We were told to return in an hour or two and that our room should be ready. When we got back at 2:00pm as instructed, our room wasn't ready as promised and we were given our room key and told that we needed to come back after 3pm. We arrived back at the hotel for the 3rd time at 3:15pm only to be greeted by a housekeeping cart blocking our hotel room and the maid stating that she needed more time to finish. So basically it took them 4 hours to get to our room ready - unacceptable! We did voice our disappointment at the desk and they apologized, it sounded like as if the guests in the room prior to our arrival prolonged thier stay unexpectedly - not our fault. Finally when we got into the room the carpet had a burn stain from an iron dropping on the floor - for this kind of hotel that should not be there - why didn't maintenance fix this? So our start to this hotel didn't go well however our weekend in Montreal far outweighed these two minor disappointments. Again, it's location, location, location! There are options that are very close to this hotel such as the St. James and the Place de Armes but these hotels are pricer than the Lhotel so the value is better. Imagine our dismay when the following day upon returning around 4pm and our room was again blocked by the housekeeping cart and the maid again stating she needed more time to finish up. Even at that, the room was missing towels which were quickly gathered up by a very willing housekeeper from the room next to ours. Our room was a superior double queen room (room 316) tucked in the corner with no view but the drab interior courtyard. The room was very quiet whereas a street view room potentially could be noiser/sunnier, so our sleep was very restful. The room had a nice bath with shower and deep tub. There was a fridge in the room as well as a nice dresser, desk, and artwork. The ceilings were like 15 feet high which makes the room feel all that much bigger. Try the Lhotel for yourself - we think you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “LHotel was Marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: travel_is_the_best58
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, wonderful bedding, location to die for! Fabulous feeling of old Montreal. One elevator was a bit inconvenient but not that horrible. Staff wasn't very responsive to an item left in the room (we never got it back) but I would say yes....go there. Priced very reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel that will surprise you when you learn about the artwork”
Reviews.Author: ahockeypuck
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a pleasurable experience for my wife and I. The location is great for excursions in Old Montreal, the Cathedral, museums, subway, and nearby sections such as Chinatown. The hotel has a great deal of charm. Service was friendly, attentive and prompt and if you need something, it simply requires asking any of the staff. The story of the very valuable art collection that hangs outside your room door is a good one to share with your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ecologyprof
Reviews.Content: We had a free VIA 1 train ticket to use on a trip from Toronto to Montreal and booked a weekend in Old Montreal for sight seeing and jazz. This hotel was lovely. The art was amazing. From Andy Warhols to the LOVE sculpture outside - we had seen a larger one in NY at Christmas. Breakfast was excellent. Great value and ambience and staff.

Reviews.Title: “No matter their name, this hotel has problems”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: Note: This hotel is now operating under the natme "Hotel L." Will duplicate this review once that new name is on Tripadvisor. MOST IMPORTANT FACT TO KNOW: This hotel DOES NOT honor reservations!!! We made reservations months in advance with credit card, confirmed them 10 days beforehand, yet upon arrival were told they did not have rooms for us. They wanted to split up our party into several different hotels, including some up to a mile away. Their only concession was to offer one-way cab fare to the new hotels. Absolutely unacceptable. It was only after standing our ground for some time at the front desk, did they miraculously find accommodations. We also saw this same thing happen to several other guests, who were being ushered out the door (even late at night) after arriving on international flights. WHO NEEDS THAT - when you've made reservations! Also, their hospitality is spotty - one of our party got coupons for breakfast in the hotel - others did not even though we all paid the same room price. The breakfast cost $12 and was not worth it at all - a few low-quality pastries, some cereal, a few slices of cheese/ham on a plate, and a waitress that was hard to find when it came time for coffee refills. Go right across the street to the cafe for half the price and twice the quality. On a positive note, the hotel itself is in a good location, the rooms are spacious and spotless, the staff was friendly and it was quiet at night. But really, what good is all that if your reservations might not be honored? My recommendation is to have a back-up plan ready because you may wind up out on the street as others did - even if you made reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaggsQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days while beginning our honeymoon. Although it can be a little hard to find if you aren't familiar with the area, the hotel is in a perfect location for sight-seeing and simply enjoying Old Montreal. Service is great, the hotel has lots of old world charm, and the rates are very reasonable. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopcarly910
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay. I felt the hotel room was perfect for the two of us, the lobby was really relaxing. It seemed to be an older crowd but that didn't bother me. The beds were comfortable and I didn't have any issues with noise at all. The view we had was of the parking lot but not a big deal for us considering we didn't pay very much. I really enjoyed the free breakfast, very simple but enjoyable. I think Old Montreal was beautiful during the day but quite boring at night. The clubs nearby seemed really lame as did the people hanging outside of them. We ate in Chinatown and the food was disgusting however the breakfast we had at Eggspectations was probably the best breakfast we ever had in our entire lives; completely worth it and right down the street. We also tried the cupcakes at Les Glaceurs and ate them in the courtyard. Beautiful cobblestone streets and the most delicious cupcakes! I would drive to Montreal again just for the cupcakes since they don't ship to the United States, believe me I've tried. I will mention that my boyfriend did feel the hotel was too small and felt strange that every time we left or returned we were greeted by the staff. I, however felt the complete opposite, everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: punkindrublic
Reviews.Content: We came to Montreal to see a hockey game and spend a few days in the city. We stayed a total of three nights at this hotel. I got a good deal on Expedia (About 100$ per night) for an "Economic" Room. The staff was very polite and helpful. They even printed out a menu for me when I inquired about restaurants that deliver late at night. The room was very clean and the nearest subway station was only a 5 minute walk. They offer the newspapers La Presse and The Gazette for free which is nice. There where a few minor issues which prevent me from giving the room a perfect score : I would have liked the Economic room to have a compact refrigerator included even if it is the best priced room. It would have been nice to have a vending machine and ice machine available in the hotel. On the first morning, the maid woke us up at 8:30 in the morning to see if she could clean the room which is way to early. And finally, the room was supposed to include wireless internet access but they where having problems with it. Fortunately, I managed to get a good connection in my room from a nearby cafÃ©. Apart from these few issues, we enjoyed our stay very much and slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely ambience, great staff”
Reviews.Author: woodrunner
Reviews.Content: I was only there for one night so did not have much of a chance to get a real feel for the place, but what little I did experience was mostly great, especially as I got a good deal on the room rate (~$120). The location was wonderful, in the heart of Old Montreal, close to everything, including the metro, which gets you everywhere else. I was impressed by the entrance and lobby and check-in was fast, by a very helpful staff member. I was also very impressed by the decor of the room: the interior decorating was lovely. A few quibbles: for one, it might have been fixed if I had stayed more than one night, but I found that the room was too hot; I prefer to sleep with a room at ~17Â°C (as that is usually easy to achieve in the winter), but no matter how far I turned down the thermostat the room was a hot 23Â°C. But I was not going to turn on the AC as that would have been environmentally irresponsible. Also, I found the matress too hard, although my colleague, in their room, found their's too soft so I guess it was the luck of the draw. And finally, as I should have remembered from the time I lived in Montreal, there is traffic until late in the night so combined with jet lag and the occasional passing vehicle I was kept up well into the night. I did not bother with the continental breakfast so cannot comment on the value for the money they charged.

Reviews.Title: “It was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled_y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 2 Queen Bed room with my family. We booked with Expedia.ca and read all the excellent reviews on their website. The location was good, it was close to restaurants and shopping. But everything else, we weren't very impressed at all. Even though we booked for 4 guests, there were only 2 sets of towels and only 1 bathrobe. We called the house keeping, they told us that there would be no more bathrobes available. We were paying for 4 people not 2! I told the front desk about this and he called the housekeeping, and somehow they found one more robe! I thought they didn't have anymore...... There was no room service menu either. I have never seen the hotel so unprepared. In the middle of the night, the electoricity was out. I was woken up by the loud beeping sound of clock radio when it was resetting or something. Of course, the alarm didn't work since the time was flashing after the blackout. In the morning, the staff with walkie-talkie was going in out out to the next room. He was talking very loud and shuting the door so loud. It wasn't once! I had stayed at four star hotels, I was treated like a welcomed guest with first class customer service. This hotel didn't offer anything the four star hotel must offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in a hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: tripmon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 2 hotels in Montreal on this trip on both ends of a visit. The Westin and this one. They are across the street from each other. The price of this hotel was $99 a night and the Westin $179. I reference the Westin in this review because the value, location and service are so different. The only thing the Westin has over the Siecle is newness and a higher cost. This is a older building and the rooms have a historic feeling so if you don't like that and want a "new" feel this is not for you. The Siecle has beautiful art work all around you but the best part is the staff goes out of there way to make you feel more welcomed than anywhere we have been in a long while. For the price we would recommend this hotel in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “A for effort but B - for execution”
Reviews.Author: 50ftqueenie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Montreal for our 4th wedding anniversary and I really wanted to stay in a boutique hotel in old Montreal. Hotel Xixe Siecle looked both elegant and within our price range. I booked a Junior Suite with a king bed and ordered a wine and cheese platter to be waiting in our room when we arrived. We got to the hotel to find ourselves booked into a regular room with a queen bed, and there was no wine and cheese platter. I asked at the front desk, where they admitted to making a mistake with the booking. They offered us free drinks at the bar and assured us that our wine and cheese would be sent right up to our room. When we got back to our room there was no wine and cheese. We waited 15 minutes and then called down to the front desk. They said it would be there shortly. We waited another 20 minutes and finally our cheese platter arrived. There was only one bathrobe in the room and we had to call down to the front desk for another one, and then to top things off, the toilet backed up the next morning. The plus side is that despite all these mishaps, the staff was unfailingly courteous and accomodating. The breakfasts that came with the room with plentiful and the breakfast room was beautiful. Hotel Xixe Siecle is a beautiful hotel with a lot of promise. They just need to work harder at following through on that promise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ozmusoadel
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great: the room, the bathroom, the location, the staff. The breakfast was a bit light on but otherwise I would not hesitate to recommend it. The foyer bar was great (if a bit expensive) and the staff were so helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, decent-but no special "Boutique" hotel here!”
Reviews.Author: Heather V
Reviews.Content: Good price for the location. The hotel is great on the outside, in a good location in Old Montreal, walking distance to all. The lobby is "okay" (read details below) The rooms were clean and decent, nothing special, slightly generic. I would consider it again, and I have no major complaints.......We stayed 4 nights over Thanksgiving. The hotel was close to full, but we hardly heard or saw anyone. HOWEVER, to be detailed and give my HONEST opinion, and just to be clear, this is not a so called "Boutique" hotel in any sense other than its small, and a bit quaint, and it ends there. I have been around to 20 countries and stayed at many "small" or "Boutique Hotels" and this one is okay, and clean, but wouldn't vote it into one of the "worlds best small hotels" listings. Things I didn't like-personal observations: The hotel employees had ugly uniforms, with bad name-tags, like they were working at a Denny's or I-hop-overall just tacky. Yet, the employees were friendly, very helpful and lovely. The entire interior design of the hotel looked like a mix of what a bunch of owners and others said they liked, all mixed together without a professional decorator to help-sorry. The art & sculptures of the hotel both on the outside and inside were STUNNING and "made" the hotel. Without them, it would have been drab. The "continental breakfast" was okay, basic. The breakfast room was nice and the breakfast staff was very helpful and sweet. Some REAL Croissants for breakfast would be nice, and some real breads? Not frozen cheap ones. I mean Montreal is FULL of great French bakeries! The music in the breakfast room, and hotel was HORRENDOUS. It was the WORST ever-think bad elevator music everywhere~no wonder no one sits in the bar either? You would think the management or owners would consider the LACK of atmosphere or originality or personality for that matter in the lounge, entrance, bar areas, and that they would wonder what they are doing wrong, and that it is empty. It's not inviting or interesting. The music at worst, should be something current (not bad 80's-90's elevator music) even some simple music like: relaxation, chill out, symphonic, zen atmospheric, French? Did anyone think " hey, lets have some FRENCH classics, French Jazz, or French chill out to add to the French thing happening here in Quebec?" For the tourists at least? Now that's a thought! The hotel COSTES in Paris, France makes the BEST mixed CD's for just that, just buy and play-problem solved! The rooms were okay, the bedding was nice enough, the mattress was decent. The bathroom was clean and nice. Overall the room was decent and clean, it was like a upscale Holiday Inn I guess or a Hilton somewhere...some basic design skills could have made the rooms MUCH nicer to look at, Colors, and fabrics, etc. They were clean enough, just generic. Overall, I would stay again for a good rate, otherwise I would spend a bit more and stay in a real "Boutique" hotel. Its too bad as the location is great and the building is really beautiful. The layout and size is nice, its just generic, and not unique. With a few simple changes, the place could be great. PS-Some real Croissants for breakfast would be nice, and some real breads? I mean Montreal is FULL of great bakeries! But it was nice to try different bakeries! Thanks! Try it out, its decent and a good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Small Gem in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: janvt
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel XIXe SiÃ¨cle. It is located in Montreal's old town just a few blocks up from the port and a block or so away from the tourist shops that abound in that area. There is free on-street overnight parking on the weekends, meters during the day, valet parking is also available. The lobby of the hotel has held different interesting art exhibits both times we have been there. The staff was accommodating, quick to help with restaurant suggestions or directions. We have had some lovely meals at restaurants that they recommended. The rooms are spacious and appear even larger because of the 14' ceilings. The furniture is very european and well kept up. Nice art on the walls. Our bathroom provided everything we needed, including a nice shower and good lighting. The lighting in the room was also good. Our package included breakfast - the dining room was nice and bright, the food was a typical hotel breakfast buffet - cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt and coffee. The location of the hotel is great; close to the sights in the old town and not a bad walk to downtown Montreal shopping. There are also buses that run close by. We would highly recommend this hotel for a romantic weekend getaway or an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a more perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: mysocalledadventures
Reviews.Content: I read all the wonderful reviews for this hotel before I booked but was a little skeptic. After my recent trip to Montreal I wanted to stay in the older part to visits museums and be close to the city's history. This hotel not only was in the heart of that area but it was so classy. My room was fantastic, large and super clean. Service was good and very helpful to me. It was a cozy stay, especially spending down time by their library and bar. I only recommend that you research restaurants nearby as it does not have one in the hotel. It also doesn't have mini fridges either. But the bar tender was nice enough to bring me tea every evening. Thanks for a stress-free vacation.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Regularry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for three nights. I loved it here. Itâ€™s very close to Notre Dame and Old Montreal. The metro is close. The rooms were very clean. The staff was always ready with suggestions and really seemed to love their beautiful city. Pick this one!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: funtravel6
Reviews.Content: This is a late report - we stayed here in April 2009. We found this hotel to be very charming. From the outside, the hotel is so beautiful. The rooms are well appointed with nice linens and the bathroom is very clean. We found the rooms to be very comfortable and spacious. The lobby does not give justice to the rooms. The staff in the hotel was always gracious and cheerful. I found their service to be top-notch. Ask for water bottles if you need any. :) The breakfast buffet held downstairs has a decent spread. Since it is in the banking district, there are several restaraunts close by including a Coffee shop across the street. Make sure to dine at "Eggspectations" which is right out of the hotel. Their crepes and meals are wonderful! You are just seconds away from the Basilique Notre-Dame and near the underground entrance as well. Keep in mind that there is a charge for parking. They will valet your car for you. I don't recall how much it was (possibly $19 CAD/day). I'm not certain if there are other private parking garages nearby. All in all, we enjoyed staying at this hotel. We would consider staying here again when we return to Montreal some day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LFdeg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the banking district and on the edge of the old city. The building is very attractive and the interior well decorated. There is no pool or exercise facility but the staff is wonderful. My wife had numerous questions and the desk staff always provided accurate and helpful answers in very good English. Suggested restaurants always had good food and reasonable prices. The valet parked our car one block away so we could easily access it. Compared to the fancier hotels in the neighborhood the price was great. I rated the room very good because there were a few threads loose and some painting errors which someone less fussy might miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBob2009
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great stay and the staff was very helpful. We had done some research and found that the staff recommended all the same sites and restaurants. We were so close to everything in the Old City and very easy to get around. We used the Metro (stop just a block away) to get to The Village and to the Olympic Park. We took a walking tour in the Old City and also saw amazing light show at Notre-Dame. The river tour was great too. But our favorite hidden gem was the house museum called ChÃ¢teau Dufresne Museum near the Olympic Park. Also check out the underground city in the old Port area at: Centre d'histoire de MontrÃ©al. This museum also had a cool light and video show that explained the history of Montreal. Then you walk under the building and see the actual ruins of the first buildings. Great food at Bonaparte, Boris Bistro and Jardin Nelson.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful! A delightful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lucy172
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel - the high ceilings, chandeliers and decor. It was very clean and the staff were warm and inviting. Anything we asked for (i.e. towels, ice) was delivered within minutes to our door and they were so helpful with ideas for restaurants, walking tours etc. It is well situated on the edge of Old Montreal but still within a 2 minute walk of the Palais de Congres (where our conference took place) and a 10 minute walk of downtown shopping. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: ebouhaha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Xixe for our first anniversary. On arrival our car was parked (and returned when we needed it for the same price it would have cost to park over night anywhere in the city, but be forewarned that parking is not included, it is extra) and we were given a city map and recommendations on walking routes, restaurants and places of interest. The service was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a great night sleep on the bed and the ceilings were high and gave the whole place a grand feel. On Montreal Marathon day and we were given a map of the course so we could watch but it included road closures and information for when we were headed out of town. We really lucked out finding this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel offering wonderful service in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: naylenk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Xixe Siecle hotel. The service was outstanding and our room was small but very nice. This is an old bank that has been transformed into a hotel. Overall, it was a great place to stay and we were able to walk all around Old Montreal from the hotel. Itâ€™s very close to the Basilica and the front desk staff will provide you with a map and information about places in the area. One thing that I should point out is that the first taxi driver didnâ€™t know what I was talking about when I said Xixe Siecle. Itâ€™s french for 19th century which he figured out and took us right there. I would definitely stay here again. The continental breakfast was $12 if I remember correctly but some websites include breakfast when booking - we really enjoyed the croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Choice Without Costing a Fortune”
Reviews.Author: ursinegrouch
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I was extremely surprised and very very pleased. The room was spacious, clean and elegant. Staff was extremely friendly and kind. Breakfast was all that it is meant to be generous and filling. Great location and I thought the price was very fair. I'm very happy to recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Charming through and through”
Reviews.Author: KingsvilleCathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring Old Montreal. It is a beautiful hotel in and outside, surrounded by great architecture and ambience. Close to the subway routes, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Palomino922
Reviews.Content: We stayed at XIX for three nights prior to taking a cruise. Our room was ready ahead of time. We loved the location--only a few short blocks from Notre Dame and all the shops and restaurants on Rue St. Paul. The towels and comp robes were beyond soft. The staff was helpful for restaurants and directions. The building maintained an old charm while its decor is up to date.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: sm10
Reviews.Content: Our family spent two nights at Hotel XIXe Siecle and we were very pleased. We liked the location, only a couple of blocks from the Basilica of Notre-Dame. The staff were outstanding -- friendly and helpful, while maintaining a quiet air of professionalism. The building is French Second Empire and the rooms themselves are lovely with high ceilings and big windows. The rooms were quiet and restful and were furnished rather elegantly. The beds were quite comfortable and the baths were very nice. There was only one tiny, tiny problem -- the temperature of the water seemed to vary in the shower. The water was always sufficiently warm, but it could become much warmer quite suddenly -- and then just as suddenly drop back to its previous temperature. The breakfast was very good and the valet parking was handled very efficiently. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This is what service is ALL about..”
Reviews.Author: fmrecords
Reviews.Content: For definitive hotel service, stay at this hotel. After a rather disappointing night in Quebec City, our arrival here was nothing short of bliss. Valet parking, someone unloaded the bags from the car, everyone has a smile from ear to ear and means it, and the place is lovely. Quiet relaxing surroundings in which to revive yourself after sightseeing etc. Knowledgable staff pointed us at fireworks display late evening, and provided an etxtensive list of recommendations for dinner. Room was spacious, well appointed, with free wireless internet. Perhaps I am wesring rosy glasses after a dreadful night in teh previous hotel but I feel as though the folks that operate this hotel love what they do and it shows....as iot should.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ARTrav81
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel in the off season of Montreal tourism. Here are some pros and cons. Pros -Very quiet! No noise from the street (with the exception of roadwork that started up before I left) or hotel clientele. -I ordered room service twice and found the food to be OK. But I still advise finding a restaurant. Room service should be a LAST resort. -Friendly and courteous staff who speak perfect English. - Conveniently located about 3 blocks from the Square-Victoria metro station and a 10-minute walk to the nearest VIA Rail Canada station. -Because you're on the border between downtown and Old Montreal, a lot of tourist sites are close by. -Free Wi-Fi -Pretty, clean rooms -I got bed service even when I didn't request it. Cons -Contrary to what the hotel's website says, it is NOT in the HEART of Old Montreal. It's actually on the far NW corner, right on the border with downtown Montreal proper. -Because the hotel is downtown, the streets are DEAD after work hours and on the weekends. So no places to shop or eat out during those times. -The free Wi-fi network is UNSECURE. So user beware. It also cut on and off on me a few times. But that might have been my own Wi-fi catcher acting up. -I can't imagine there being any great views in this hotel unless you have a suite. I could see a little bit of the Basilique Notre-Dame de Montreal from my bedroom window though. -Only one VERY slow elevator. Take the stairs down. With the cons being of little significance (to me anyway), I would highly recommend this hotel. I also suggest going to Montreal in late April/early May. Not a lot of folks around and the weather was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anglophile2004
Reviews.Content: My eldest daughter and I travelled to Montreal to bring back my younger daughter after her first year at McGill University. After one night squashed into her residence room (trying to rough it and economize!) I logged into her computer and searched Montreal hotels! I phoned Hotel XIX Siecle and got a last minute rate for two nights and we were able to check in at noon that same day. We had a large room at the front of the hotel (fourth floor) with two queen beds. It was heavenly. So much space for the three of us and our luggage! The beds were comfortable and the linens warm and cosy. We like it cool at night so we were able to turn down the temperature overnight with in-room controls. I liked the bathroom very much. The lighting was nice and sparkly and the tub nice and deep. Another comment I read on TripAdvisor said the water wasn't hot enough. I wonder if they realized you can adjust the temperature. The handle turns on/off but there's another slider bar for the temperature. We found the location to be perfect. Valet parking was much appreciated. It's a $22/day charge with unlimited in's and out's. I had parked overnight at the university the night before and was charged $23 for 10 hours of street parking on campus so this was much superior. We enjoyed walking around Old Montreal and ate at several great unique restaurants. We had breakfast in the breakfast room on the second morning. It was so good that we were wishing we had gone there the previous morning as well. The price of $10 per person was extremely reasonable for the beautiful selection. The breakfast room is beautiful and the server was attentive and pleasant. Staying at this hotel saved our three-day Montreal visit from being a disaster and turned it into a very enjoyable experience. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and value in a prime location - a real gem.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelchoicehelp
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a complete delight, with friendly, helpful staff, an excellent location only five minutes walk from the metro and underground city, and about ten minutes walk to Vieux Montreal. My room ( booked as an economy package) had an extremely comfortable bed with high quality bedding, good lighting and furnishings and a very clean and commodious bathroom with lovely toiletries in generous sizes ( and replaced daily). I had breakfast on one day, but the dining room was almost empty, although the breakfast was fine. There are lots of places in the immediate vicinity where you can get continental or cooked breakfast for the same sort of price ( CD10). As a middle-aged woman travelling alone, I felt safe and comfortable. There is an elegant bar area adjacent to the lobby, with sofas and magazines, as well as free internet access and a printer - useful if you want to check-in online for your flight home. Drinks were reasonably priced ( no more expensive than outside the hotel and with the bonus of a happy hour from 5-7pm). Other guests at the hotel were mostly middle-aged couples or singles, with a few business people. Although the hotel doesn't have a designated luggage room, they looked after my two huge suitcases in their basement, all day on my day of departure, and made no charge for this. Staff at the hotel organised my taxi to the airport ( flat rate of CD38) took all my luggage out to the taxi for me. They could not have been kinder or more helpful, all spoke good English and made me feel very welcome. I would certainly stay there again and recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: conleykid15
Reviews.Content: Great Staff: they are very friendly and knowledgeable about the city. They are ready to help you whenever you need help. If you only speak English, don't feel intimidated to speak to them in English. They are very good at speaking both French and English. The hotel rooms are big. Bed's are comfy. The pillows are either to soft or two hard. The square one with the hotel's name on it was a good medium. Bathrooms are clean. The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from the metro, the Science Museum, Rue St. Laurent, Rue Peel (Rue= Street), and a couple of other popular streets. About mile or two away you can get to Rue Cresent which has a few bars, night clubs, and a Hard Rock Cafe. Lobby is a really nice area to sit and enjoy a drink, work on the computer (free wifi), and just shoot the breeze with people. Pizza was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: cokeandblow
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was great, spoke good english and was friendly for the whole stay. Room was very nice size for the price of around 90â‚¬ per night. Location is ok, I was in middle of cold winter so used taxi to get around, but based on little walking I got the imperssion that this is really good location during summer when you dont freeze to death by just walking 200meters. Couple little complaints, my room wasnt exactly quiet, I think the biggest issue was the door wasnt really sound proof and then the pipes made little noise. However the noise wasnt so bad that it would have gotten annoying and id have to go complain. 2nd issue is that it was impossible to seet he television from the bed, so if you are like me who needs little TV to fall asleep this might be a small issue. Overall I think staying at this hotel during your montreal visit is a decent idea.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of old montreal”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: Using the guidance of Tripadvisor, we booked this hotel and got a great rate on a suite with parking and breakfast included. The hotel is in a great location steps from the famous Notre Dame Cathedral in old Montreal. The hotel itself is beautiful with old world charm - room was huge with great amenities. Service was good with valet parking, bellboy, free newspaper and coffee downstairs in the jmorning, FREE wifi internet. You cannot go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, hope new owners keep it up”
Reviews.Author: dads55
Reviews.Content: Love to stay here when I can, great value right on the doorstep of Old Montreal. Have stayed for business and pleasure iun the past.. Staff helpful and friendly, rooms with vaulting cielings and French provincial furniture for that Parisian feeling, don't like the bar/restaurant but there are many to choose from in the neighborhood even for breakfast. New owners propose to change the name and do a reno but here's hoping it remains an affordable place to stop in a really special piece of North America.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ravindustries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Montreal twice, once staying on the corner of Ste Catherine Ouest (close to the bar-scene) and this time at the Hotel Xixe Siecle. We LOVED it! The location is perfect, as we could walk to Notre Dame, all of Old Montreal, and only a few blocks away is the metro stop to take you anywhere. The lobby is great with a small bar and sitting area with floor to ceiling books. The staff was incredibly helpful, valet parking was quick and attentive. The rooms were gorgeous. We stayed in a small suite with a separate sitting area. High ceilings, french doors, everything perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable boutique hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: megasmile
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable boutique hotel located on a very pretty street. You are located in walking distance of beautiful old Montreal and a short cab ride to the great shopping on rue St. Catherine. We found the room extremely spacious and comfortable. The bed was fantastic and the bathroom was clean and well-supplied. The World Cup was on while we were visiting and my husband was able to enjoy a lot of it because the TV in the room was big with great reception! (sometimes hotel TVs can be small and sketchy!) We found that the room was particularly quiet, which we appreciated- you really couldn't hear any noise outside. The breakfast included was standard, the breakfast area was in a windowless room that could have been improved upon. But no complaints with the quality of the breakfast. The service was excellent and we were very happy with our stay. We would likely return as the value we received was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dvaughn971
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is well located near the Place d'Arms on a quiet side street. You get the benefit of being near most everything in Veiux Montreal without the noise. The clean rooms are very large with comfortable beds and tall ceilings. The staff is friendly, but a little overworked. One evening, the bartender/bell hop/valet had been away from the bar for quite some time while some thirsty patrons were waiting at the small bar. Finally, another staffer came to pour drinks, but assured us that his bartending skills did not go beyond beer and wine. We were happy to oblige, but it would be nice to have more consistent service at happy hour. This small issue is the only problem we had during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful bouquet hotel, EXCELLANT LOCATION,”
Reviews.Author: AIRAM1
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Hotel Xixe Siecle July 28 - 31st 2008. It was our first visit to Montreal-we were not disappointed.The hotel is beautiful, we could not fault any thing about it. The Hotel being bouquet is much better than named international hotels, the service is much more personel. If you dont speak french - dont worry, the staff speak english.I have enclosed photos of the hotel and bedroom, and belive it or not the main toilets on the ground floor! I had to take photos of the wallpeper really quirky. The hotel is decorated in french design, very comfortable. Our bedroom (Classical) was decorated in gold and cream. we had a tv, pleanty of storage, but no facilities to make tea or coffee. the bathroom was adequate, shower over the bath, plenty of good quality linen, the free products of shampoo etc, were of a high quality.The staff are wonderful and are more than willing to help you enjoy your stay. They provide directions, order tickets for you, advise on places to go. VERY helpful. The lobby has a very good stock of Montreal information brochures. The Bar, Breakfast room,and Library are also on the ground floor, here there is free internet . Breakfast -conti.excellant.fab choices.Bottle of water - you are not charged, this was one of there thoughtful touches. The couches and chairs at reception clean and very comfy. The lastest magazines are always on hand.. The location is excellant, you are one street away from the Bas. of Notre Dame - DO NOT miss the light show - Fantastic. The old town is on your door stop, the shopping of Catherine street - out of the hotel walk a few yards turn right, travel up road and you are on Catherine Street.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: caneelwed
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel after reading many reviews on tripadvisor. We were pleased with our room, nice high ceilings, great bed and linens. They were a little stingy with the towels but we do appreciate their efforts to be "green". The hotel is in a perfect location- very close to Old Montreal but not in the thick of it, walking distance to most of the attractions in Montreal. The staff was very helpful. Our only complaint was that the shower did not have much pressure and it did not get very warm. All in all a great place to stay- we would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: uksteveb
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Fantastic location near Old Town and Subway. We got a Jr Suite and were very happy with the staff, rooms and breakfast supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: dfctrip
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed for a week in July. The hotel was in a perfect location to walk to the "old town" or up and over to St. Catherine St. for shopping. Easy access to metro and only a few blocks from the Central Train Station. I cannot rave enough about the friendly, unassuming, helpful staff...so professional! Our room exceeded my expectations. We had a "standard" room that was beautiful! High ceilings, very large amount of floor space, nice furnishings, lovely old windows, and a huge bathroom with separate jacuzzi tub and shower! We never ate at the hotel, but did enjoy complimentary coffee and and an occasional apple from the bowl! Montreal itself is a lovely city with friendly people and numerous activities to keep one entertained...

Reviews.Title: “Real Old Town Charm and Character at XIXe Siecle”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLeo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus a group of friends stayed at XIXe Siecle the past weekend of July 08. If you want to experience the real charm of old town Montreal, this is definitely the place to stay. The Hotel was everything we expected. The photos on their website mirror everything on offer. The bathrooms were spotlessly clean and the room was large and comfortable. Our friends had one of the suites and the room was large with an adjacent sitting room. The breakfast included in our price was fantastic. Hard boiled eggs, cheeses, thinly sliced ham, cereals, croissants... the list goes on...! The dining room is quaint and relaxing. It made for a lovely start to the morning. We have stayed in other chain hotels in Montreal previously, and they were decent, but for the same price, cannot compare to Hotel XIXe Siecle! Staff were fantastic and very helpful. The location is great, a close enough walk to the Port and also to St Catherines Street for shopping. All in all a fantastic experience and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gets17
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed a few nights at Hotel Xixe Siecle and we're thrilled - the rooms were spacious and clean, the staff friendly and attentive, and the breakfast delicious! We will stay there again on future Montreal trips!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sb631
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekend at Hotel Xixe Siecle. I selected this hotel based almost entirely upon reviews at TripAdvisor and was very pleased. The room was quite large, clean and extremely comfortable. The included breakfast had a lot to offer and favorable hours (7-11). The hotel offers valet parking but the desk clerk offered the option of parking on the street for free and gave me tips on where to find the coveted spots. This hotel is not overdone with pushy service and that is one of the things I found to be great. No one trying to wrestle my bags away from me. No one being paid to open the door, just good, friendly and courteous basic service. The lobby bar/lounge was very nice. Two for one drinks from 5-8). This was an excellent experience and I WILL go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: cyberi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Xixe Siecle was an excellent stay. I am writing this review on the day of departure from my room which has to be one of the best rooms I have stayed in my many years of domestic and international travel. I drove up from Boston (5 hours) for a weekend stay with my daughter (15). The hotel is situated in Old Montreal and minutes walk from the Montreal Metro. Therefore most of the city is accessible. However, the calm of the area, the closeness to the water and the mangificent buildings of old Montreal made this a very peaceful vacation. The hotel is Boutique, so if you are more comfortable in the traditional Marriot type hotel you may not be as comfortable here. The style is European and I would recommend this for couples (new and old). Restaurants in the area are good. Gibby's seems popular and a nice setting. I tried the new Sushi Rest called Tatami which is unusal in that the tables are actually fish tanks and the food is artfully done. We walked St Catherine street, had ice creme nearby with the locals and really had a relaxed time. I am coming back and would try for this hotel again. Worth every star of its 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Buttonbox
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal going directly to the hotel (2 nights almost half-price, third night free, complimentary continental breakfast). We had a wonderful stay in the Hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our room was comfortable and spacious. The hotel is well located. The bar/lounge and the dining room were cheerful, well-staffed and the breakfast was very good. The staff helped us out with recommendations for places to eat and things to do. We would definitely try to book the Hotel Xixe Siecle the next time we visit Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetee Pie
Reviews.Content: We booked our Queen bed room online at hotels.com for $114/night CDN. We stayed for 2 nights during the week of Valentine's. The room itself is well appointed with a Queen size bed, desk, TV and wardrobe for hanging clothing. Celings are very high (at least 15 feet). Washroom is smaller but functional. The towels were very plush and luxurious. This hotel as stated by other reviewers is a renovated older building so there is definitely character in this building which is great since it's located in Old Montreal. Vicinity wise, there is an Eggspectations across the street which opens at 6am and serves breakfast/lunch. We had breakfast on our last morning in the hotel and weren't very impressed.
